pair.h: Clinton and Obama rally together.

pair.t: For a Democratic party anxious to project an image of one big happy family before the presidential election, it was an irresistible conjunction of symbols: twin flag-draped podiums deposited in a field of clover in a remote little town called, to the political image-makers' delight, Unity. And Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama, both consummate performers, did their best to milk the venue for maximum political advantage. They stood shoulder to shoulder, hugged, whispered in one another's ears, smiled.
pair.h: Clinton and Obama rally together.

pair.t: Hours before being greeted by the biggest crowd of his campaign, Democrat Barack Obama quietly told a small group of seniors Sunday that Republican John McCain would threaten the Social Security they depend on because he supports privatizing the program.
pair.h: Clinton and Obama rally together.

pair.t: Over the next five decades, Solzhenitsyn's fame spread throughout the world as he drew upon his experiences of totalitarian duress to write evocative novels like "The First Circle" and "The Cancer Ward" and historical works like "The Gulag Archipelago."
pair.h: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn was an author.

pair.t: Alexander Solzhenitsyn, the dissident whose novels exposed the horrors of the Soviet Union's prison-labor-camp system, won him the Nobel Prize for literature and resulted in a 20-year exile, has died at 89, according to media reports Sunday.
pair.h: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn was an author.

pair.t: Sixteen Chinese policemen have been killed in an attack on a border post near Kashgar city in the western region of Xinjiang, state media say.
pair.h: Border assault leaves 16 policemen dead.

pair.t: Microsoft has kicked off a research project to create software that will take over when it retires Windows. Called Midori, the cut-down operating system is radically different to Microsoft's older programs.
pair.h: Microsoft plans for the end of Windows.

pair.t: In mid-July, representatives of Microsoft traveled to San Francisco in search of people who hated Windows Vista. The company recruited 140 Mac and PC users who thought Microsoft's latest operating system was slow, that it crashed constantly, that it was incompatible with various devices, and that installing it would be a pain.
pair.h: Microsoft plans for the end of Windows.

pair.t: Condoleezza Rice, the US secretary of state, has held her first meeting with North Korea's foreign minister, urging him to accept new measures to verify the dismantling of the Stalinist state's nuclear weapons programme.
pair.h: Condoleezza Rice holds nuclear talks with North Korea.

pair.t: Condoleezza Rice holds 'very good' nuke talks with N Korea. Top diplomats from the Six-Party Talks held an unprecedented meeting in Singapore on the nuclear disarmament of North Korea, an encounter hailed as 'very good' and 'quite significant' by two key players.
pair.h: Condoleezza Rice holds nuclear talks with North Korea.

pair.t: The International Atomic Energy Agency said plutonium had leaked in one of its laboratories Sunday but no radiation escaped the building and no one was hurt. The agency said in a statement the leak happened in the high security area of its nuclear lab in Seibersdorf, 35 kilometers (22 miles) south of Vienna.
pair.h: Plutonium leak has occurred at a plant in Austria.

pair.t: No radioactivity was released into the environment by a plutonium leak at an International Atomic Energy Agency just south of Vienna, the agency said. The agency said in a statement the leak happened in the high security area of its nuclear lab in Seibersdorf, 35 kilometers southeast of Vienna.
pair.h: Plutonium leak has occurred at a plant in Austria.

pair.t: The leak, which occurred in the early hours of Sunday, automatically set off an alarm via an air-monitoring system, said Daniel Kapp, a spokesman for Austria's environment ministry. He added that radioactivity in the air would have been completely contained by the lab's filters, and Austrian monitoring centres had detected no increase in radioactivity, meaning no-one was in danger.
pair.h: Plutonium leak has occurred at a plant in Austria.

pair.t: Sieman's mixed oxide nuclear fuel fabrication plant was closed down as the result of a plutonium leak followed by a leaking roof. Three workers suffered slight contamination. The plutonium leakage was from a damaged container and was graded as an 'B' (urgent) incident.
pair.h: Plutonium leak has occurred at a plant in Austria.

pair.t: Oscar-winning actor Morgan Freeman is in "good spirits" after being injured in a serious car accident near his Mississippi home. Mr Freeman's spokeswoman says he has a broken arm, broken elbow and minor shoulder damage.
pair.h: Morgan Freeman was involved in a car accident.

pair.t: Freeman and a woman were extracted by paramedics after the 11:30 p.m. wreck and airlifted to the hospital, according to Angie Underwood, a Mississippi Highway Patrol spokeswoman.
pair.h: Morgan Freeman was involved in a car accident.

pair.t: Rwanda has accused France of playing an active role in the genocide of 1994, in which about 800,000 people were killed.
pair.h: France is accused of genocide in Rwanda.

pair.t: The two-year investigation said France helped the extremists who carried out the genocide and even took part in some of the killings. It named François Mitterand, France's late former president, and former prime minister Dominique de Villepin among 33 military and political leaders.
pair.h: France is accused of genocide in Rwanda.

pair.t: Oil prices touched three-month lows of $118 a barrel on Tuesday amid signs of rising supplies and slowing demand. US crude fell as low as $118 a barrel, before recovering to $119.13. Brent crude fell by $2.33 to $118.35.
pair.h: Oil prices fall to this year's lowest price.

pair.t: Oil prices have tumbled to seven-week lows amid concerns that the slowing US economy will weaken demand. US sweet, light crude fell $2.23 to settle at $123.26 a barrel - more than $20 off their peak earlier in July, when prices reached a record $147.27.
pair.h: Oil prices fall to this year's lowest price.

pair.t: The Arctic holds as much as 90bn barrels of undiscovered oil and has as much undiscovered gas as all the reserves known to exist in Russia, US government scientists have said in the first governmental assessment of the region's resources. The report is likely to add impetus to the race among polar nations, such as Russia, the US, Denmark, Norway and Canada, for control of the region.
pair.h: The Arctic has 90bn barrels of oil

pair.t: The Guinean President, Gen. Lansana Conte, on Monday sacked Sam Mamady Soumah as minister for the second time in less than a week for "desertion of post," according to a presidential decree read on the state-owned Guinean Radio television (RTG).
pair.h: Guinean minister has been sacked twice in less than a week.

pair.t: Gorillas, orangutans, and corals are among the plants and animals which are sliding closer to extinction. The Red List of Threatened Species for 2007 names habitat loss, hunting and climate change among the causes.
pair.h: Gorillas face extinction crisis.

pair.t: Conservationists on Thursday announced the rare birth of a mountain gorilla in Congo, but warned the threat of extinction remained with nearly 10 percent of the animals' population there wiped out this year alone.
pair.h: Gorillas face extinction crisis.

pair.t: Juan Evo Morales Ayma (born October 26, 1959 in Orinoca, Oruro), popularly known as Evo, is the President of Bolivia, and has been declared the country's first fully indigenous head of state in the 470 years since the Spanish Conquest. The latter claim is controversial, as several mestizo presidents preceded him.
pair.h: Evo Morales is the president of Bolivia.

pair.t: No matter how French officials ultimately resolve the problem posed by Marina Petrella, it's certain to outrage someone. Sought by Italy for her 1992 conviction on charges of murder and kidnapping, the former Red Brigades terrorist was ordered free on bail by a French appeals court Tuesday over concerns about Petrella's perilous health.
pair.h: Marina Petrella was a terrorist.

pair.t: Portuguese police are closing the investigation into the disappearance of Madeleine McCann, according to local media reports. Her parents Kate and Gerry McCann are both official suspects in the case, along with a third man Robert Murat.
pair.h: Robert Murat is a suspect in the case of the disappearance of Madeleine.

pair.t: There have been no face-to-face talks yet - Israeli and Syrian delegations sit in separate hotels while Turkish mediators shuttle back and forth with messages.
pair.h: Israeli and Syrian delegations are staying at the same facilities.

pair.t: The events in the political arena weighed on Malaysia's financial markets, with foreign exchange dealers saying they suspected the central bank had stepped in to support the ringgit currency against the dollar.
pair.h: International financial markets are influenced by Malaysian political events.

pair.t: At least 80 percent of Zimbabwe's population now lives below the poverty line, often skipping meals and walking or cycling to work in order to stretch their incomes to the next payday.
pair.h: More than 70 percent of Zimbabwe's population is poor.

pair.t: Senator Barack Obama and former President Bill Clinton shared a 20-minute conversation on Monday, their first talk since the combative Democratic presidential primary season ended nearly a month ago.
pair.h: Barack Obama and Bill Clinton had a talk on democracy.

pair.t: As Mr. Obama arrived here for a campaign stop, he reached Mr. Clinton by telephone. The two men covered a variety of issues, aides to both said, including how Mr. Clinton could help in the fall campaign.
pair.h: Obama phoned Mr. Clinton.

pair.t: African Union leaders ended their summit in Egypt yesterday refusing to condemn President Mugabe, cementing his hold on power even as they urged the establishment of a national unity government in Zimbabwe.
pair.h: African Union leaders had a meeting in Egypt.

pair.t: "He has come here as President of Zimbabwe. He will go home as President of Zimbabwe," George Charamba, Mr Mugabe's spokesman, said.
pair.h: George Charamba works for Mr Mugabe.

pair.t: It invited 50 people from around the world, including five from the UK, to surf without spam filters. The experiment revealed that UK residents are most likely to be targeted by the infamous Nigerian e-mails and "adult" spam.
pair.h: An experiment in the UK invited people to use Internet with no spam filter.

pair.t: "Many of our participants noticed that their computers were slowing down. This means that while they were surfing, unbeknownst to them, websites were installing malware," said Guy Roberts, director of McAfee's labs in Europe.
pair.h: McAfee's labs in Europe are interested in websites.

pair.t: Non-hospital care would be reimbursed by the home state up to the level the patient could expect at home, according to reports. But the state would not reimburse expensive treatment received abroad that was unavailable in the patient's home country.
pair.h: Sometimes non-hospital care will not be reimbursed.

pair.t: Police are continuing to question four teenagers who were arrested in connection with the death of Ben Kinsella in north London.
pair.h: Ben Kinsella lived in north London.

pair.t: Earlier, a spokesman for Mr Mugabe welcomed the AU call for dialogue. The opposition Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) leader withdrew from last week's poll citing widespread state-sponsored violence.
pair.h: Mr Mugabe has three spokesmen.

pair.t: At the end of a two-day summit, which ended in Egypt on Tuesday, AU leaders approved a resolution calling for the "creation of a government of national unity" in Zimbabwe. Mr Tsvangirai said the resolution did not acknowledge the illegitimacy of the 27 June run-off vote.
pair.h: Zimbabwe voted on 27 June.

pair.t: With the exception of punk-disco-rock band The Gossip, whose singer Beth Ditto was incomparable in "Standing in the Way of Control", Friday's bill was unchallenging. Kate Nash opened and The Fratellis and Editors touted their impressive, radio-friendly anthems, forcing the more discerning fans to head to the Other Stage for math-rock quintet Foals and Vampire Weekend.
pair.h: Beth Ditto sings punk-disco-rock music.

pair.t: Adopting just a couple of elements of the Mediterranean diet could cut the risk of cancer by 12%, say scientists. A study of 26,000 Greek people found just using more olive oil alone cut the risk by 9%.
pair.h: Mediterranean foods increase the risk of cancer because of olive oil.

pair.t: The Mediterranean diet came under scrutiny after researchers noticed lower rates of illnesses such as heart disease in countries such as Spain and Greece.
pair.h: Spain and Greece have lower rates of heart disease.

pair.t: Sara Hiom, from Cancer Research UK, said the research highlighted the importance of a healthy balanced diet. "It shows there are a number of things you can do, and there is no one 'superfood' that can stop you developing the disease."
pair.h: Sara Hiom is on a diet.

pair.t: Prostitution in UK and people-trafficking is now the third most lucrative black-market trade in the world after gun-running and drugs-smuggling. It is being driven by growing demand for prostitutes in the UK, with websites promoting sex flourishing and local newspapers carrying advertisements for prostitutes. Gangs often share the income from internet "bookings".
pair.h: Prostitution in the UK is more lucrative than drugs-smuggling.

pair.t: In London, the continuing threat of an attack on Iran, the world's fourth largest oil producer, sent Brent crude to $145.75 a barrel, while in Asia, oil for August delivery was trading at $144.35 - more than 30 per cent higher than prices at the end of last year.
pair.h: The threat of an attack on Iran influenced the price of oil.

pair.t: Around 40 per cent of the world's tanker traffic passes through the Strait of Hormuz, and a closure could push prices significantly higher.
pair.h: Prices will go up by 40 per cent.

pair.t: Ingrid Betancourt, who was held hostage by Colombian rebels for six years, has hailed the "perfect operation" which saw troops free her and 14 other hostages without firing a single shot.
pair.h: Colombian rebels held 15 hostages.

pair.t: Ms Betancourt said: "The helicopter almost fell because we started jumping. We screamed, we cried, we hugged. We couldn't believe it."
pair.h: All the people in the helicopter cried.

pair.t: Evans said she had contacted all 60 members of Welsh Assembly to discover what their personal experiences of domestic and sexual violence had been. Of the eight that replied, five knew of someone who had suffered a sexual assault, including the three who said they had been raped. None had reported the matter to the police.
pair.h: All the members of the Welsh Assembly replied to Evans.

pair.t: "These results show that sexual assault and domestic abuse cast their shadow across the whole of Welsh society and to a great extend they are going unreported and therefore they're not stopped" Evans said.
pair.h: Evans is a victim of sexual assault.

pair.t: However, Manchester United insist that the decision on whether Ronaldo will have an operation is still to be made. "Procedures are in place to seek specialist advice, in order to finalise the treatment plan as soon as possible," a club statement said.
pair.h: Manchester United wants to finalise the treatment plan as soon as possible.

pair.t: Speaking at a press conference held by video link from Lebanon, Shiekh Hassan Nasrallah said that the Shia Islamist group had also agreed to supply Israel with information on the airman Ron Arad, who went missing in 1986.
pair.h: Shiekh Hassan Nasrallah is from Lebanon.

pair.t: A controversial part of the agreement is the release of Lebanese prisoner Samir Kantar, a militant serving a 542-year sentence for killing two men and a four-year-old girl in a 1979 raid on northern Israel. The brutality of that attack horrified Israelis.
pair.h: In 1979 Israel was attacked.

pair.t: He said that Mr Abramovich's resignation did not mean an end to his work for Chukotka. The oligarch's Millhouse group would continue investing in regional projects and his charity foundations would also keep up their activities.
pair.h: Mr Abramovich created some charity foundations.

pair.t: Top Zambian officials are denying reports that President Levy Mwanawasa has died, news agencies reported Thursday.
pair.h: News from top Zambian officials report that Levy Mwanawasa is dead.

pair.t: US Continental Airlines and two of its employees are to stand trial for manslaughter over the crash of an Air France Concorde airliner in 2000 that killed 113 people, officials said Thursday.
pair.h: In 2000 at least 113 people died in an air crash.

pair.t: The New York-bound Concorde crashed in a ball of fire shortly after takeoff from Paris Charles de Gaulle airport on July 25, 2000, killing all 109 people on board and four workers on the ground.
pair.h: The crash killed 113 people.

pair.t: The two employees, both US citizens, are John Taylor, a mechanic who allegedly fitted the non-standard strip, and the airline's chief of maintenance Stanley Ford.
pair.h: Stanley Ford is a US citizen.

pair.t: Honda would be interested in double Formula One world champion Fernando Alonso if he wants out of Renault and cannot move to Ferrari, team boss Ross Brawn said on Thursday.
pair.h: Fernando Alonso works for Honda.

pair.t: "We are fairly happy with our two drivers, we'll be interested to see what Fernando does," the former Ferrari technical director told Reuters at the British Grand Prix. "He's a great driver and a world champion. If he chooses not to stay at Renault then I think every team would be interested in what he's going to do. But it's no more than that."
pair.h: Ferrari technical director says he is a great driver.

pair.t: The man was released on the orders of the Special Immigrations Appeal Commission, a court that reviews the deportation, detention, and extraction of non-U.K. nationals considered a security threat by the British Government. The Commission holds hearings in private and doesn't publish complete versions of its rulings.
pair.h: The rulings of the Special Immigrations Appeal Commission are not fully available to the public.

pair.t: The U.K. government also links U to the planning of an attack on the Strasbourg, France, Christmas Market in 2000 and in an earlier plan to attack Los Angeles Airport, the ruling said. U has been in custody since May 2001.
pair.h: U was in Strasbourg on Christmas 2000.

pair.t: In Westminster yesterday Members of Parliament voted 172 to 144 to back an amendment by former minister Don Touhig to keep the ACA and subject it only to internal, rather than external, audit.
pair.h: Members of Parliament sit in Westminster.

pair.t: In Le Figaro, an anonymous blogger writes: 'In the United Kingdom, urban violence is at a very high level. 'Gangs kill each other with knives over territories, but the English media doesn't talk about it because these outbreaks of violence are occurring daily so it is no longer shocking.'
pair.h: Urban violence is infrequent in the UK.

pair.t: The first non-stop flights from mainland China to Taiwan, since the two sides split in civil war, left for the island Friday. The regular weekend flights could bring as many as 3,000 mainland tourists per day to Taiwan.
pair.h: China has no direct flights to Taiwan.

pair.t: In Beijing, a ceremony was held at the airport marking the launch of the non-stop cross-Strait flights. Several Chinese officials spoke at the ceremony and welcomed the improved transportation links.
pair.h: Several Chinese officials took part in a ceremony in Beijing.

pair.t: Curtis committed suicide in May 1980, hanging himself in his kitchen just before Joy Division were due to tour the United States. He was 23.
pair.h: Curtis died in 1980.

pair.t: The past year has seen a slew of new business related phrases enter the public consciousness. And some of these terms have become so widely accepted they have been awarded a place in the latest edition of the Concise Oxford English Dictionary (OED).
pair.h: Oxford English Dictionary includes some new terms from business related phrases.

pair.t: Gordon Brown has urged Britons to stop wasting food as he arrived in Japan for a G8 summit which will be dominated by rising prices and the world economy.
pair.h: There was a G8 meeting in Japan.

pair.t: Gabriel Ferez and Laurent Bonomo, both 23, were bound, stabbed to death and set alight in a bedsit in New Cross, south-east London, last weekend.
pair.h: Gabriel Ferez and Laurent Bonomo were in London.

pair.t: "Indian defence attaché, Brigadier Mehta, has been killed in the blast. The defence ministry will be sending a transport aircraft to bring back the bodies of those killed and the injured," he said.
pair.h: Brigadier Mehta was the Indian defence minister.

pair.t: Sunday's blast came on the first anniversary of the ending of a siege at the city's Red Mosque, in which more than 100 people died during fighting. The mosque was stormed by Pakistani troops to evict militants who had taken sanctuary within its complex.
pair.h: The Red Mosque was assaulted by Pakistani military forces.

pair.t: An Indian Foreign Ministry official confirmed that Indian nationals were among the casualties, and said embassy officials going to work were the target of the attack at about 8:30 am outside the embassy gate.
pair.h: Indian officials have been attacked.

pair.t: "The only thing I want to ask Mr. Gontard is why he appears in the emails of Raul Reyes as bearer of the 500,000 dollars," Santos said.
pair.h: According to Raul Reyes Gontard was carrying $500,000.

pair.t: A Wayne County man is dead after being hit by a freight train. Police say 55-year-old Leon Wright of Newark was trying to cross the CSX tracks in Arcadia when he was hit by a passing train at around 10 p.m. Sunday.
pair.h: A Wayne County man died in an accident in Arcadia.

pair.t: The collision caused significant damage to the train car, she said. "Some windows were broken and (the driver) hit right on the door, so that car isn't going to be usable for a while."
pair.h: After the collision the car was unusable.

pair.t: A university which boasts that its new campus "leads the field" in energy efficiency has been ranked among the lowest in the UK in a survey of green higher education institutions. Queen Margaret University has come 93rd in the People and Planet Green League, which examined the eco-friendly credentials of 119 universities.
pair.h: Queen Margaret University is one of 119 universities examined in the People and Planet Green League.

pair.t: Edinburgh University dropped eight places in the Green League, coming in at 26th place, while Napier University ranked 56th and Heriot-Watt came 67th.
pair.h: Napier University is ranked higher than Edinburgh University.

pair.t: On July 6, Shin Tae-seop, a professor at Dong-eui University, revealed the transcripts of several recorded conversations that demonstrate the university has been pressuring him to resign from the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology and a "position beyond the ministry's control." Shin was sacked from the school on June 20 after refusing to resign from his post as director of KBS.
pair.h: Shin Tae-seop resigned from his post at Dong-eui University.

pair.t: A study by the University of Exeter and Cornwall Wildlife Trust, published in the journal Biodiversity and Conservation (July 7, 2008) has revealed a disturbing rise in the number of whales, dolphins and porpoises found dead on Cornish beaches.
pair.h: The University of Exeter and Cornwall Wildlife Trust investigates suspicious cetacean deaths in Cornwall.

pair.t: The research team analysed records of cetacean strandings from 1911 to 2006 from around Cornwall's north and south coasts and the Isles of Scilly.
pair.h: Before 1911 no dead cetaceans were found on the coast of the Isles of Scilly.

pair.t: Many people were shocked by the recent graphic images of the mass dolphin strandings in Cornwall; the cause of which is still a matter of conjecture.
pair.h: Mass dolphin strandings cause shock.

pair.t: Large areas of wetlands need to be created in the next half century to protect wildlife, reduce the risk of flooding and store carbon, conservationists say today.
pair.h: The risk of flooding is reduced by the creation of wetlands.

pair.t: Mr Bush writes: "I wish for a world free from tyranny: the tyranny of hunger, disease; and free from tyrannical governments. I wish for a world in which the universal desire for liberty is realized".
pair.h: Mr Bush hopes hunger, disease and tyranny will be defeated all over the world.

pair.t: "We very strongly believe the Litvinenko case to have had some state involvement, there are very strong indications that it was a state action," the senior security official told the BBC.
pair.h: The BBC thinks Litvinenko death involves the government.

pair.t: During a private meeting at the G8 summit in Japan, the Prime Minister is understood to have raised the assassination of Litvinenko in London, problems faced by oil company BP operating in Russia, and the treatment of the British Council – which has been forced to close several Russian offices.
pair.h: Prime Minister was in London during the G8 summit.

pair.t: The Church of England's ruling General Synod has voted to consecrate women as bishops and approved a code of practice aimed at reassuring opponents.
pair.h: There are female bishops in the church of England.

pair.t: Google has defended its controversial Street View photo-mapping tool, saying it will meet local privacy laws in European countries at launch. The tool, which matches real world photos to mapped locations, has drawn fire from some privacy campaigners.
pair.h: Street View photo-mapping tool creates privacy issues.

pair.t: In the UK, Privacy International said Street View photo-mapping tool could breach data protection laws if people's faces were shown. Google has said it is using face blurring technology to preserve the privacy of individuals photographed.
pair.h: Street View photo-mapping tool does not show people's faces.

pair.t: Flanders and Swann also celebrated German wart hogs, the English bus system, the African gnu and the Australian armadillo. An added touch was that they sang of these non sequiturs in several languages, including Greek and Latin.
pair.h: Flanders and Swann sang in German, Greek and Latin.

pair.t: The contrast is cruel. While Tony Blair and his party surge ahead in the polls, France's discredited, divided, and demoralised Socialists will be wondering aloud this weekend, at a Paris convention, what future they have beyond the presidential election in May. The 103,000 Socialist Party members throughout the country, still shocked by Jacques Delors' decision not to stand on their behalf, lack anyone of the stature of former Prime Minister Pierre Beregovoy, who committed suicide in 1993.
pair.h: Pierre Beregovoy was Prime Minister of France.

pair.t: The 103,000 Socialist Party members throughout the country, still shocked by Jacques Delors' decision not to stand on their behalf, lack anyone of the stature of former Prime Minister Pierre Beregovoy, who committed suicide in 1993, or Michel Rocard, sacked as party leader last year.
pair.h: Michel Rocard has been leader of the Socialist Party since 1993.

pair.t: The bush fires in southeast Australia - more than 150 of them, more than half attributed to arsonists - began to break out in the first days of this month. About 1.5 million acres of grassland and forest in the state of New South Wales have burned. Some flames rose in Sydney's suburbs, destroying more than 200 homes, killing four people.
pair.h: The bush fires in Australia killed several people who couldn't flee.

pair.t: About two dozen of the 70 national parks in the state of New South Wales closed during the fires, either because of immediate flames or to reduce fire risks posed by 100-degree temperatures and 60 m.p.h. winds.
pair.h: The state of New South Wales has 70 national parks.

pair.t: In Puerto Rico, the trouble began Jan. 7 when the barge Morris J. Berman hit a coral reef and spilled 750,000 gallons of heating oil, coating an estimated 20 square miles of ocean.
pair.h: The barge Morris J. Berman sank the 7 of January.

pair.t: In Puerto Rico, the trouble began Jan. 7 when the barge Morris J. Berman hit a coral reef and spilled 750,000 gallons of heating oil, coating an estimated 20 square miles of ocean.
pair.h: Morris J. Berman lost more than 700,000 gallons of oil.

pair.t: Physicians said the 1,019 cases reflected in Tuesday's report represent a significant sample of veterans who have sought treatment for Gulf War syndrome. Of the 697,000 who served in Operation Desert Storm, 11,000 have complained of illness. Some 8,000 are being processed.
pair.h: About 11,000 physicians are affected by Gulf War Syndrome.

pair.t: The state church's 1,200 woman deacons and their supporters are expected to pack Bristol Cathedral today for the ordination of 33 women by Bishop Barry Rogerson.
pair.h: Bishop Barry Rogerson ordained 1,200 woman deacons.

pair.t: Some of my favorite olive oils include Frescobaldi "Laudemio" and Badia a Coltibuono from Italy, James Plagniol and Old Monk from France, L'Estornell Certified Organic from Spain, and Olio Santo from the Napa Valley.
pair.h: Frescobaldi "Laudemio" is a brand of Italian olive oil.

pair.t: Things have changed, of course, not just because of the democratisation of the Czech Republic, but also thanks to the finance and management expertise from which Skoda now benefits as part of the Volkswagen group.
pair.h: Volkswagen group owns Skoda.

pair.t: Comedian Billy Connolly is to star as Deacon Brodie in a new 90-minute Screen One film for BBC TV.
pair.h: Deacon Brodie will be interpreted by Billy Connolly.

pair.t: In addition, hints were dropped that opera singer Dame Kiri Te Kanawa would be singing at a special open air concert at Rugby Park, Kilmarnock, in the summer.
pair.h: Dame Kiri Te Kanawa will sing in the summer.

pair.t: According to prosecutors, Bernal wanted to buy a young gorilla to replace one that had died at the Toluca, Mexico, zoo, one of two national zoos and 16 parks under his jurisdiction. Bernal called Berges, and he made the contact in Miami, prosecutors said.
pair.h: Bernal wanted to buy a gorilla from the zoo of Toluca.

pair.t: American stockbroker Steve Fossett, 50, yesterday became the first person to cross the Pacific Ocean alone in a balloon, soaring above Canada on a journey from Seoul, South Korea.
pair.h: A stockbroker started his journey in a balloon from Seoul.

pair.t: Despite Timmel's protests, and after a 35-minute delay during which a ground crew searched in vain, the airplane flew back to New York - presumably with the cat somewhere aboard - less than two hours after it arrived.
pair.h: The airplane was delayed 35 minutes.

pair.t: Roberto Pia, Argentina's national railroad commission president, said recently that the system deteriorated steadily over the years because of a lack of maintenance and investment, and in 1989 only one of every two locomotives worked and more than half the track was deemed unsafe.
pair.h: Roberto Pia is president of a commission.

pair.t: The Winter Palace is the oldest of the buildings which make up the famous Hermitage Museum. Can there be anything more spectacular? One glittering room gives way to another and another - more than a thousand in the palace alone - revealing an imperial treasure of art which runs from Leonardo da Vinci and Rembrandt to Picasso.
pair.h: In the Hermitage there are masterpieces by Leonardo da Vinci.

pair.t: The consensus among scientists not directly part of the investigation seems to be that Ramirez and the emergency room personnel were exposed to organophosphates, chemicals that are among the primary ingredients of nerve gas and many agricultural pesticides.
pair.h: Ramirez invented many agricultural pesticides.

pair.t: It is a fund-raising recital, and the group will donate the entire proceeds to the poor and hungry of St. Sofia's Cathedral in Tsarskoe Selo, near St. Petersburg - formerly Leningrad.
pair.h: St. Sofia's Cathedral is situated in Tsarskoe Selo, near St. Petersburg.

pair.t: The concert will coincide with the climax of a visit to Scotland by Father Gennady Zverev, Archpriest of St. Sofia's Cathedral.
pair.h: A concert will be given in honour of the Archpriest of St. Sofia's Cathedral.

pair.t: But XTRA passed, so Williamson had to buy time on Orange County's KORG to get an L.A. outlet.
pair.h: Williamson lived in Los Angeles.

pair.t: Korean car maker Kia Motors Corp. appointed its U.S. operations chief to its board of directors.
pair.h: Kia sells its cars in Korea.

pair.t: While the original 121 has re-materialised as the Korean-built Kia Pride, the present model takes the same high-roof approach which provides much better passenger space than you might expect from its other dimensions.
pair.h: Kia Pride is bigger than the original 121.

pair.t: In the early 1980s Kia was directed to concentrate on commercials, and it was only allowed back into car production some years later. Now it builds more than 600,000 cars, buses, trucks, sport utilities and other vehicles in a year.
pair.h: Kia sells more than 600,000 vehicles in a year.

pair.t: For one thing, Pordenone is now a manufacturing center, the home of Zanussi, Italy's biggest maker of appliances and considered the country's second largest industrial firm after Fiat.
pair.h: Fiat is the largest industrial firm in Italy.

pair.t: It is hard to like Will Carling. Honestly, that has nothing to do with the fact that he is captain of the England rugby team (again), but a lot to do with his status as an insufferably rude brat.
pair.h: Nobody likes Will Carling, because he's rude.

pair.t: After a brief training career and a year in prison for tax offences Lester Piggott made a return to the saddle in 1990.
pair.h: Lester Piggott spent a year in prison.

pair.t: Triple jumper Jonathan Edwards was named BBC Sports Personality of the Year last night - after tipping boxer Frank Bruno, who came second, for the award.
pair.h: Jonathan Edwards has three brothers.

pair.t: "One of the key markets is Japan, whose companies are globalising and putting research labs into Europe,'' says the trust's chief executive, Dr. Stephen Hammond, who has held senior positions in large pharmaceutical companies such as Astra, Smithkline Beecham and Glaxo.
pair.h: Stephen Hammond worked for some big pharmaceutical companies such as Astra, Smithkline Beecham and Glaxo.

pair.t: Glaxo Wellcome, the world's biggest drugs company, received a boost yesterday with news that the US Food and Drug Administration had approved a patent extension on its ulcer drug Zantac to 1997.
pair.h: GLAXO is the world's biggest drugs company.

pair.t: Flexoset, which makes printed polythene, polypropylene and laminated film products for the food industry, fits well with the current activities of BPI's retail division.
pair.h: Flexoset works for BPI's retail division.

pair.t: They include Nguyen Chi Thien, the Vietnamese poet, who disappeared following his arrest in 1979, after he had handed a manuscript of his anti-government poems to a foreign diplomat.
pair.h: Nguyen Chi Thien is a Vietnamese poet.

pair.t: They include Nguyen Chi Thien, the Vietnamese poet, who disappeared following his arrest in 1979, after he had handed a manuscript of his anti-government poems to a foreign diplomat.
pair.h: Nguyen Chi Thien was killed by Vietnamese police.

pair.t: A band that takes its name from a Monty Python skit, plays an impromptu version of ABBA's "Dancing Queen," celebrates humiliation in a song called "Stupid" and observes in another that a departing lover bends her words "like Uri Geller's spoons," obviously has a sense of humor.
pair.h: ABBA's songs were against prejudices.

pair.t: The polygraph came along in 1921, invented by John A. Larson, a University of California medical student working with help from a police official. The device ostensibly detects when a person is lying by monitoring and recording certain body changes affected by a person's emotional condition.
pair.h: The polygraph is a device that ostensibly detects when a person is not telling the truth.

pair.t: His visit will be the first by a top Clinton foreign policy-maker since the arrest of CIA officer Aldrich H. Ames on charges of selling secrets to Moscow.
pair.h: Clinton will visit Aldrich H. Ames.

pair.t: Warning that the "business of intelligence is too important not to do well," the House Select Committee on Intelligence on Wednesday sharply criticized the CIA for a series of management failures that permitted disgraced spy Aldrich H. Ames to sell U.S. secrets to the Russians, leading to the deaths of undercover agents.
pair.h: Russians bought U.S. secrets from a CIA spy.

pair.t: Ames met and married Maria del Rosario Casas Ames, a low-level Colombian diplomat recruited to be a paid agent for the CIA - and also, according to some who knew the couple, a strong-minded woman of expensive tastes.
pair.h: Ames and Maria were married in Colombia.

pair.t: Ames, a 31-year CIA veteran who once headed counterintelligence in the Soviet section, and his wife, Rosario, were arrested Feb. 21 on charges of spying for the Soviet Union and then Russia. They have been held without bail, and their son has been cared for by friends and relatives.
pair.h: Ames worked for the CIA for 31 years.

pair.t: Yitzhak Rabin, Prime Minister of Israel, was born in Jerusalem, March 1, 1922, and died in Tel Aviv, November 4, 1995.
pair.h: Yitzhak Rabin was Prime Minister of Israel.

pair.t: Frosties (or Frosted Flakes in North America and various other areas) is a cereal similar to Corn Flakes from Kellogg's, but coated with frosted sugar.
pair.h: Frosties are sugar-frosted cereals.

pair.t: SkyEurope Airlines is a low-cost airline with its main base at M. R. Stefanik Airport (BTS) in Bratislava, Slovakia, and other bases in Kraków, Prague, Budapest and Vienna.
pair.h: SkyEurope is based in Bratislava, Prague and Vienna.

pair.t: The greenhouse effect, discovered by Joseph Fourier in 1824 and first investigated quantitatively by Svante Arrhenius in 1896, is the process in which the emission of infrared radiation by an atmosphere warms a planet's surface.
pair.h: The greenhouse effect was discovered by Fourier.

pair.t: A Liverpool art student and perhaps the closest friend of John Lennon, Sutcliffe played bass guitar for three years with the Beatles - but well before their stratospheric rise to fame began in 1963.
pair.h: Sutcliffe was an art student.

pair.t: The iPod is a brand of portable media players designed and marketed by Apple and launched in 2001.
pair.h: Apple launched iPod in 2001.

pair.t: Born in Azmir, Turkey, Edouard Balladur's parents emigrated to Marseille in 1935 along with their five children.
pair.h: Edouard Balladur's parents emigrated to find a job.

pair.t: From 1968 to 1980, Edouard Balladur was president of the French company Mont Blanc Tunnel while occupying various other positions in ministerial staff.
pair.h: Edouard Balladur was on the ministerial staff.

pair.t: Of all the flavours that have been introduced or are still on the market, Cheese and Onion remains the most popular in the UK.
pair.h: The British love onions.

pair.t: Bread is a staple food of European, Middle Eastern and Indian cultures and is prepared by baking, steaming, or frying dough.
pair.h: Bread is a very common food in India.

pair.t: The NHS Pension Scheme is a large pension scheme for people who work for the English and Welsh National Health Service. It is administered by the NHS Pensions Agency, which is now a Special Health Authority at arm's length from the Department of Health.
pair.h: The NHS Pension Scheme is a scheme for everyone who works.

pair.t: Not only are they being fished unsustainably, sharks are also being caught in nets intended for swordfish and their numbers are also being put under threat. The swordfish, along with the marlin, is the fastest fish in the ocean, capable of reaching speeds of 120kmh in quick bursts.
pair.h: Swordfish can reach a speed of 120kmh.

pair.t: The acceleration of the shrinking of Arctic ice continues to threaten the survival of these animals. Scientists predict that the numbers of polar bears will fall by about a third, if sea ice in the Arctic continues to melt at its present rate.
pair.h: The level of Arctic ice will fall by a third.

pair.t: The dairy farm of Kibbutz Ramat Menashe is located in the north of Israel in the Menashe River and Dalia River watershed, north of the Dalia River Nature Reserve and its tributaries and near the Shelef River, in an area characterized by high hydrological sensitivity.
pair.h: Kibbutz Ramat Menashe is located in an area of high hydrological sensitivity.

pair.t: Over the past four years, Houston Mayor Bill White has launched a variety of initiatives to put pressure on area industrial facilities with unacceptably high emissions of toxics, including the carcinogens benzene and 1,3-butadiene.
pair.h: Bill White has been mayor of Houston.

pair.t: The partnership between researchers at the University of New Brunswick, the University of Toronto, the Tianjin University of Science and Technology in China, Montreal-based FP Innovations-Paprican and Quebec-based Tembec Industries is "ideal", said Zhirun Yuan, a senior scientist working on the project with FP Innovations-Paprican.
pair.h: Zhirun Yuan works for an university.

pair.t: The current series of projects and funding announcements, said Yuan, marks the first time the organization has facilitated partnerships between Canadian and Chinese organizations. Previously they have funded partnerships with Israel and India.
pair.h: Yuan speaks Chinese and Canadian.

pair.t: An Indian-origin researcher in the US has conceived a way to make air conditioners that can track human movement through the different rooms of a house. Shwetak Patel of the Atlanta-based Georgia Institute of Technology says that his idea is based on a device that detects small differences in air pressure as people pass from one room to another.
pair.h: The Indian-origin researcher Patel has a house in Atlanta.

pair.t: Vaclav Havel, the anti-communist dissident who became Czech president, is ending nearly 20 years of self-imposed exile from the theatre with a new play that some critics consider his best.
pair.h: Vaclav Havel was the Czech president.

pair.t: Vaclav Havel, the anti-communist dissident who became Czech president, is ending nearly 20 years of self-imposed exile from the theatre with a new play that some critics consider his best.
pair.h: Communists imposed Vaclav Havel's exile from the theatre.

pair.t: I like the French Polynesian islands that people are less familiar with, such as Moorea, Bora Bora, the Marquesas and Tetiaroa, which was owned by Marlon Brando. It really feels like paradise there.
pair.h: Tetiaroa belongs to French Polynesia.

pair.t: The IRA should stand down its ruling Army Council to bring lasting peace to Northern Ireland, the Rev Ian Paisley said yesterday in an emotional final speech as Democratic Unionist Party leader in Belfast. After more than three decades he has handed the reins to his deputy, Peter Robinson.
pair.h: Rev Ian Paisley is the leader of the Army Council.

pair.t: Robinson, 59, who is renowned as a tough, shrewd political operator, will replace Paisley as Northern Ireland's First Minister this week. He was a founding member of the DUP in 1971 and its deputy leader since 1980.
pair.h: Paisley founded the DUP.

pair.t: Margaux Powers graduated from the elite Taft School in Connecticut, where she played lacrosse, before spending her college years at the University of Vermont and Cornell. She graduated from Cornell with a bachelor's degree in English.
pair.h: Margaux Powers obtained her bachelor's degree at the Taft School.

pair.t: Florida is the second largest nursery crop-producing state in the nation and the nation's number one foliage (plants used for indoors) producing state growing nearly 70 percent of all foliage plants in the United States. FNGLA is the largest state nursery/landscape association in the country with 2,500 member firms.
pair.h: Florida is the largest producer of nursery crop.

pair.t: The Florida Department of Transportation will discuss the projects during an open house from 5 to 7 p.m. Wednesday at the department's public information office, 1161 Kew Gardens Ave., Suite 101, Palm Beach Gardens.
pair.h: The Florida Department of Transportation has a public information office at Palm Beach Gardens.

pair.t: Anthony James David, 31, of Spring Hill, advised his girlfriend against taking two prescribed antibiotics, to her detriment, investigators said Monday. He then gave her a prescription drug to treat her ailment. David has no medical license in Florida, "or anywhere else we can find," Tampa police narcotics Capt. Hugh Miller said.
pair.h: Anthony James David is a licensed doctor in Tampa.

pair.t: Anthony James David, 31, of Spring Hill, advised his girlfriend against taking two prescribed antibiotics, to her detriment, investigators said Monday.
pair.h: Anthony James David and his girlfriend are from Spring Hill.

pair.t: Nikola Gruevski's center-right conservatives won 48.3 percent of the vote, far ahead of the Social Democrats' 23.4 and enough to give him a majority in the 120-seat parliament.
pair.h: Nikola Gruevski has the majority in parliament.

pair.t: It's the latest challenge for Samsung Electronics Co., Coca-Cola Co. and Lenovo Group Ltd, the official backers of the flame's 129-day global journey to Beijing, following violence, reshuffled routes and criticism from groups pressing China over human rights.
pair.h: The Olympic flame's journey lasts 129 days.

pair.t: Speed Skating Canada announced Friday that Neal Marshall, a three-time Olympic speedskater and coach with Speed Skate Canada since 2002, is no longer employed by the organization and a search is underway to find his replacement.
pair.h: Neal Marshall is employed in Canada.

pair.t: Marshall spent 10 years on the national speedskating team, competing at the 1992, 1994 and 1998 Olympics.
pair.h: Marshall won the 1994 and 1998 Olympics.

pair.t: Romanian Prime Minister Calin Popescu-Tariceanu on Wednesday asked International Olympic Committee (IOC) chief Jacques Rogge for support in his country's bid to host the 2013 winter European Youth Olympic Festival and the 2022 Winter Olympic Games.
pair.h: Romania will host the 2022 Winter Olympic Games.

pair.t: The knifeman who carried out Japan's worst killing rampage in central Tokyo yesterday, killing seven people, may have been planning the attack for months.
pair.h: A man killed seven people.

pair.h: Seven people were killed by a knifeman in Tokyo.

pair.t: A speech Barack Obama gave at the University of Nairobi when he last visited Kenya in 2006 hardly sounded like a primer for someone who has literally taken this country, and Africa, by storm.
pair.h: Barack Obama went to the University of Nairobi.

pair.t: Britain deployed troops to Afghanistan shortly after the attacks of 11 September, 2001. Few then thought that British forces would still be in Afghanistan in far larger numbers seven years on, nor that they would be involved in some of the fiercest fighting British forces have seen in decades, as part of Nato's International Security and Assistance Force (ISAF).
pair.h: Britain has 11 troops that take part in Nato's International Security and Assistance Force.

pair.t: The lines are getting longer, and Tang Yao is finding fewer gasoline stations open in his neighborhood here. But the 48-year-old motorist has no gripes about the price at the pump.
pair.h: Tang Yao is 48 years old.

pair.t: Protests flared late last week in India, where the government upped prices by about 10%, and there were calls for mass rallies in Malaysia after gasoline prices jumped 41% overnight.
pair.h: The price of fuel is increasing in India and Malaysia.

pair.t: The Bush administration, in an aggressive new effort to keep illegal immigrants out of the workforce, on Monday ordered all companies doing business with the federal government to begin ensuring their employees can legally work in the U.S.
pair.h: Bush provides incentives for illegal workers.

pair.t: Meeting separately with Slovenian President Danilo Turk and Prime Minister Janez Jansa at Brdo Castle in the tiny town of Kranj before the U.S.-EU summit, Bush praised the beauty of this small Central European nation.
pair.h: The Brdo Castle is located in Kranj.

pair.t: Following a trend across much of the nation, violent crime in Seattle, Bellevue and Tacoma saw a significant drop in 2007, according to statistics released Monday by the FBI.
pair.h: The violent crime rate decreased in Bellevue in 2007.

pair.t: Mr. de la Vega worked closely with Apple Chief Executive Steve Jobs on the deal that made AT&T the exclusive U.S. provider of the iPhone, which was a smash hit in its first year.
pair.h: Mr. de la Vega is the AT&T Chief Executive.

pair.t: Kaiser's 156,000 employees will be eligible for a pilot program connecting the Oakland health maintenance organization's health records with Microsoft's HealthVault, a free, Web-based medical database the company began in October.
pair.h: Kaiser has at least 156,000 workers.

pair.t: An article published in the June 9 issue of Archives of Internal Medicine reports that men who have low levels of vitamin D are at a higher risk of heart attack (myocardial infarction).
pair.h: Vitamin D causes myocardial infarction.

pair.t: New York City Opera general manager-designate Gerard Mortier has announced that composer Charles Wuorinen will write an opera version of the story for the company's 2013 spring season.
pair.h: Mortier is manager-designate of the New York City Opera.

pair.t: Mr Griffin grew up in Long Beach, California, and is known for helping popularise G-funk rap, a West Coast-branded style of hip-hop that emerged in the early 1990s.
pair.h: Mr Griffin plays G-funk rap.

pair.t: In 1977 to wide media fanfare, Polanski was charged with a host of sexual crimes for his involvement with a 13-year-old girl. He was subsequently convicted of unlawful intercourse with a minor, but fled the country in 1978 before final sentencing.
pair.h: Polanski escaped in 1978.

pair.t: In 1977 to wide media fanfare, Polanski was charged with a host of sexual crimes for his involvement with a 13-year-old girl. He was subsequently convicted of unlawful intercourse with a minor, but fled the country in 1978 before final sentencing.

pair.t: Happiness comes from following the prophets of God, Bruce L. and Christine Olsen told Latter-day Saints gathered on the campus of Southern Virginia University Saturday for the second session of its annual two-day Education Conference.
pair.h: Bruce L. and Christine Olsen are prophets of God.

pair.t: The gambusia affinis, dubbed the mosquito fish, is an aquatic predator that devours mosquito larvae. Officials are releasing the fish into the fetid waters of abandoned pools to reduce the burgeoning mosquito population.
pair.h: Gambusia is a species of mosquito.

pair.t: The gambusia affinis, dubbed the mosquito fish, is an aquatic predator that devours mosquito larvae. Officials are releasing the fish into the fetid waters of abandoned pools to reduce the burgeoning mosquito population.

pair.t: Donna Stallings, and her husband, Roosevelt Stallings - who have five children, including some with allergies and one who fears dogs - had asked the board to reconsider Kimble's decision.

pair.t: Four people were killed and at least 20 injured when a tornado tore through an Iowa boy scout camp on Wednesday, where dozens of scouts were gathered for a summer retreat, state officials said.
pair.h: Four boy scouts were killed by a tornado.

pair.t: Judge Alex Kozinski was on the hot seat after the Los Angeles Times disclosed that a Web site of his contained numerous sexual photos and videos - showing nudity and bestiality - while he was preparing to preside over an obscenity trial in Los Angeles.

pair.t: Kozinski, 57, was appointed to the Ninth U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals by President Ronald Reagan in 1985. At the time, he was the nation's youngest federal appellate judge.
pair.h: At the age of 57, Kozinski is the youngest federal appellate judge.

pair.t: A second meeting in 1998 was held in Shanghai, but a 1999 meeting was canceled by Beijing when then-Taiwanese President Lee Teng-hui proposed that Taiwan and China treat each other as two separate states.
pair.h: In 1999 Lee Teng-hui was the President of Taiwan.

pair.t: Our sister planet Venus makes her appearance this month on the west-northwest horizon about 9 p.m.

pair.t: On July 9, the giant gas planet Jupiter rises at sunset and sets at sunrise.
pair.h: Jupiter is made of gas.

pair.t: When Tyson Gay crossed the finish line in the men's 100 meters yesterday, the crowd at Hayward Field gasped. The clock displayed 9.68 seconds. Everyone at the US Olympic track and field trials knew what that meant.
pair.h: Tyson Gay ran 100 meters in 9.68 seconds.

pair.t: Gay ran the fastest 100 ever, regardless of conditions. When the public address announcer reported a tailwind of 4.1 meters per second (9.5 miles per hour), the crowd groaned, knowing Gay did not break the world record of 9.72 set by Jamaican Usain Bolt May 31.
pair.h: Gay holds the world record in the 100 meter run.

pair.t: Tomatoes carrying a rare form of salmonella that has sickened more than 800 people may still be on the market, federal officials said yesterday, two weeks after they first warned consumers about the risk.
pair.h: Two federal officials bought tomatoes at the market.

pair.t: Most of the houses affected are decades old, and many are owned by people of modest means who did not have flood insurance.
pair.h: The houses destroyed by the flood are in the old part of the city.

pair.t: Giuliani is a rather familiar sight at Yankee Stadium, but on Friday, he appeared in Houston as a guest of Astros owner Drayton McLane. The former Mayor was invited to throw out the first pitch prior to the opener between the Astros and Yankees, the first-ever regular-season meeting between the two teams.
pair.h: Giuliani was mayor of Houston.

pair.t: Barely six months after her marriage with the French President, supermodel Carla Bruni has admitted having problems with her "conservative" hubby Nicolas Sarkozy's "right-wing politics".
pair.h: Carla Bruni and Sarkozy were married.

pair.t: Barely six months after her marriage with the French President, supermodel Carla Bruni has admitted having problems with her "conservative" hubby Nicolas Sarkozy's "right-wing politics".
pair.h: Carla Bruni is the French President.

pair.t: The National Association of Purchasing Management-Chicago said today its business index increased to 49.6 this month from 49.1 in May.
pair.h: The National Association of Purchasing Management saw an increase in its business.

pair.t: Peter Griffin, from the Colchester Hospital University NHS Foundation Trust, is understood to have left the password-protected computer in the car while it was parked in Edinburgh on June 18th.
pair.h: Peter Griffin is from Edinburgh.

pair.t: Peter Griffin, from the Colchester Hospital University NHS Foundation Trust, is understood to have left the password-protected computer in the car while it was parked in Edinburgh on June 18th.
pair.h: Peter Griffin was born on June 18th.

pair.t: On the last night of peace, the Apache pilots and mechanics of Charlie Company, 1st Battalion, 101st Aviation Brigade threw a party. It was St. Patrick's Day, or near enough, and Chief Warrant Officer Sherman Hartley had just learned he was going to be a father.
pair.h: Sherman Hartley is a Chief Warrant Officer.

pair.t: Margaret Davies, 77, of School Road, Rassau, had just finished a Sunday lunch on Father's Day at the Rhyd-y-Blew's restaurant when she slipped and broke her hip.
pair.h: Margaret Davies ate lunch with her father.

pair.t: The Palm Beach County School District is investigating an incident where a 4 year-old autistic girl went missing for hours.
pair.h: An autistic girl went to the beach for hours.

pair.t: Gas prices seem to climb every day and Tuesday is no exception.
pair.h: Gas prices decrease on Tuesday.

pair.t: Neil Baxter, 51, had seen his wife Wendy, 45, and her friends onto a plane back to Scotland from an airport in Italy on Monday morning. Hours later his motorcycle was involved in a collision with the lorry.
pair.h: Wendy drove a motorcycle.

pair.t: Neil Baxter, 51, had seen his wife Wendy, 45, and her friends on to a plane back to Scotland from an airport in Italy on Monday morning. Hours later his motorcycle was involved in a collision with the lorry.
pair.h: Neil Baxter died in a collision with a lorry.

pair.t: The late hotel magnate Leona Helmsley, who died last August, left instructions that all her possessions, valued between $5bn (£2.5bn) and $8bn, go in trust for the dogs.
pair.h: A woman left her estate to the dogs.

pair.t: Mr Lowy has briefed British Prime Minister Gordon Brown about Westfield's development plans at Stratford City, which is part of the government's regeneration strategy for east London, where the main events of the 2012 Olympics will be held.
pair.h: Stratford is in east London.

pair.t: Sheriff's detectives are looking for a 34-year-old former Oceanside resident they say went on a four-day shopping spree in April with her company credit card and racked up more than $150,000 in purchases.
pair.h: Sheriff's detectives spent $150,000 shopping.

pair.t: Work on the shops and car park started last July and was expected to last 62 weeks.
pair.h: Work ended earlier than the expected 62 weeks.

pair.t: A sister of Florencio Marimon Sr., captain of the sunken MV Princess of the Stars, believes that her brother is dead.
pair.h: Princess of the Stars is a ship.

pair.t: The 280-metre-long HMS Queen Elizabeth and HMS Prince of Wales will be capable of carrying up to 40 aircraft.
pair.h: Queen Elizabeth is also Princess of Wales.

pair.t: The 280-metre-long HMS Queen Elizabeth and HMS Prince of Wales will be capable of carrying up to 40 aircraft.
pair.h: Queen Elizabeth is married to the Prince of Wales.

pair.t: Ingrid Betancourt hugged her children for the first time in six years Thursday at a teary reunion in Colombia's capital, Bogota. Betancourt raced up the stairs toward the door of a French government plane and threw her arms around her children, Lorenzo, 19, and Melanie, 22, who arrived on a flight from Paris.
pair.h: The children of Ingrid Betancourt are 19 and 22 years old.

pair.t: Ingrid Betancourt hugged her children for the first time in six years Thursday at a teary reunion in Colombia's capital, Bogota. Betancourt raced up the stairs toward the door of a French government plane and threw her arms around her children, Lorenzo, 19, and Melanie, 22, who arrived on a flight from Paris.
pair.h: Ingrid Betancourt hasn't seen her children for 6 years.

pair.t: For Jennifer Watts, The Huntington's curator of photographs, and independent curator Claudia Bohn-Spector the answer was to divide the exhibit in three ways.
pair.h: Jennifer Watts is a curator.

pair.t: Di Matteo, 38, replaces Paul Ince, one of his old opponents, after the former Manchester United midfielder became the manager of Premier League Blackburn Rovers.
pair.h: Di Matteo and Paul Ince are enemies.

pair.t: Samuel Israel, the former hedge fund manager who had been on the run for almost a month since faking his own death, was yesterday taken into custody in Massachusetts.
pair.h: Samuel Israel pretended to be dead.

pair.t: Roman A. Abramovich is a billionaire Russian investor, a soccer club owner and a yachtsman.
pair.h: Roman Abramovich plays soccer.

pair.t: Scotland Yard detectives have twice visited Bulgaria in three months in a final attempt to solve the murder of Georgi Markov, in which the Bulgarian dissident was jabbed with a poisoned umbrella while waiting for a London bus in 1978.
pair.h: Georgi Markov was poisoned.

pair.t: Scotland Yard detectives have twice visited Bulgaria in three months in a final attempt to solve the murder of Georgi Markov, in which the Bulgarian dissident was jabbed with a poisoned umbrella while waiting for a London bus in 1978.
pair.h: Scotland Yard detectives suspect Markov of murder.

pair.t: The opposition Antigua Labour Party (ALP) has blasted that country's prime minister, Baldwin Spencer, for publicly advocating that Cuba's Fidel Castro be awarded the Order of the Community (OCC) - the Community's highest honour.
pair.h: Baldwin is Antigua's Prime Minister.

pair.t: She's best known for playing ice queen Connie Beauchamp in BBC One's drama Holby City, but actress Amanda Mealing will be all smiles if she succeeds at this year's TV Quick and TV Choice Awards.
pair.h: Amanda Mealing plays the role of Connie Beauchamp.

pair.t: Award-winning writer Jimmy McGovern is to make a BBC daytime drama series which partly takes its inspiration from the Ingrid Bergman movie The Yellow Rolls-Royce.
pair.h: Jimmy McGovern owns a Rolls-Royce.

pair.t: For a long time, turban-wearing Apu in the hit animated TV series The Simpsons has been Hollywood's most successful Indian "actor".
pair.h: The Simpson series takes place in Hollywood.

pair.t: By the time children reached 18 months of age, 54% of women had returned to work.
pair.h: 18 women out of 100 have children.

pair.t: http://www.mobiletrend.net has just launched their portal for everything that relates to instant, downloadable digital accessories including free ringtones, wallpapers, games, videos, and photos for mobiles. In fact, everything that is needed to "pimp" your mobile can be found and instantly downloaded on the website.
pair.h: A New Free Ringtones Portal was launched at mobiletrend.net.

pair.t: MobileTrend offers a unique, clean interface allowing site visitors to spruce up their mobile and set their mood to song. Presented by ringtone experts (and fanatics), MobileTrend caters to its visitors by letting them control the website's offerings, be it ringtones, tutorials, or other digital accessories.
pair.h: A New Free Ringtones Portal was launched at mobiletrend.net.

pair.t: Currently, the website offers more than 100 of the most popular ringtones of today and yesterday. And, unlike other ringtone sites, MobileTrend validates their expertise by offering free ringtone advice, tutorials and reviews of popular ringtones. In addition to standard mp3 ringtones, MobileTrend is also one of the leading providers of polyphonic ringtones, increasing their collection daily by allowing site visitors to register and upload the polyphonic ringtones they create.
pair.h: A New Free Ringtones Portal was launched at mobiletrend.net

pair.t: Emerald InTouch is a Web space and hosting service designed to support learning and collaboration by bringing together technologies such as blogs, wikis and RSS into one place.
pair.h: Emerald announces the launch of its new learning network service: InTouch.

pair.t: Eric Broug, Emerald's Business Manager for Africa, explains, "Emerald InTouch is an ideal tool for business management training and education. It supports distance learning courses, encourages networking and provides a space to share ideas and group reflections."
pair.h: Emerald announces the African launch of its new learning network service: InTouch.

pair.t: Join Emerald in celebrating the launch of Emerald InTouch on Thursday, 29th May at 10.30-11.15am, where delegates are invited to visit stand M28 for a product demonstration and a chance to speak to Emerald's senior product developer, Paul Coyne, about how this innovative new service could benefit your institution. Delegates are invited to enter our launch competition for the chance to win a mobile phone!
pair.h: Emerald announces the launch of its new service: Emerald InTouch.

pair.t: Dr. Kelley has been featured as a keynote speaker at many major conferences and school districts and has become one of the most in-demand speakers in the U.S. His consulting company has quickly risen to being one of the top educational consulting companies in the nation.
pair.h: Dr. Ron Kelley's Edu-Rap educational CD has been added to the 2008 Grammy Awards ballot.

pair.t: TacticalCalendar.com, a recently-launched web site that aims to provide students with tactical training courses available in their area, is already garnering a large amount of interest. Students who are looking for tactical training courses and opportunities in their local area now have a resource that gathers all the information they need in one place.
pair.h: Students wanting to keep up to date on tactical training finally have their wish granted.

pair.t: The primary goal of this website is to keep students from all over the country up to date on tactical courses being offered in their local areas. This benefits both the students and the course instructors by keeping enrollment numbers up and our country free in the process.
pair.h: Students now can be up to date with a website.

pair.t: OWIKits Inc announced today that it will be exhibiting its RobotiKitsTM line of products at the National AfterSchool Conference on March 12-14, 2008 at the Greater Fort Lauderdale/Broward County Convention Center in Ft. Lauderdale, Florida. Attendees are invited to visit the OWIKit Booth to see the educational OWI¨ Solar Robotic kits, Robotic Arm Edge and other creative robot kits including the award-winning OWIKit Junior Science Series.
pair.h: OWIKit brings a new line of solar powered RobotiKit brand products to the National AfterSchool Conference.

pair.t: RobotiKit, science, and mini solar kit lines are creative educational products that teach the basics of robotics, electronics, and alternative energy principles. The kits provide everyone a fun learning experience of creating a solar powered racecar, hopping frog, frightened grasshopper and more. Exciting characters and a better understanding of solar power make these kits the ultimate science project.
pair.h: OWIKit brings a new line of solar powered RobotiKit brand products to the National AfterSchool Conference.

pair.t: These kits are ideal to introduce everyone to the benefits of alternative energy sources. The kits are available in a series of different fun forms, including Frightened Grasshopper, Peppy Orangutan, Attacking Inchworm, Aerial Cable Car, Sonic F1 [racecar], Flapping Sea Gull, and a Valiant Viking Ship. Part of the Jr. Science Series, they are designed for kids 9 and older. The kits are priced from $11.95 to $17.95 SRP.
pair.h: OWIKit brings a new line of solar powered RobotiKit brand products to the National AfterSchool Conference.

pair.t: In 1980, OWI saw a need for products that would introduce new technologies to the educational communities. Utilizing its comprehensive technology and research background, the RobotiKits Direct Company emerged to fulfill that distribution channel. The kits the company developed are being used in science educational centers, the classroom, in science clubs, and to satisfy the curiosity of young scientists in the home. There are five levels of kits challenging builders from grade school to adult.
pair.h: OWIKit brings a new line of solar powered RobotiKit brand products to the National AfterSchool Conference.

pair.t: Disaster activist, Brenda Calbert, has teamed up with Neekam Inc to create the Rapid Disaster Response Blog. Readers can keep up with the latest news on Florida disaster response, disaster response incident command, disaster response information, disaster response animal rescue and levels of disaster response.
pair.h: A disaster activist starts Rapid Disaster Response Blog.

pair.t: The rapiddisasterresponse.com blog is also meant to help spread awareness about formulating disaster response plans at all government levels; beginning long-term recovery planning as soon as the imminent disaster has passed; appointing liaisons within local and national recovery offices for local officials and creating within the federal law governing disaster response a special category for large-scale disasters.
pair.h: A disaster activist starts Rapid Disaster Response Blog.

pair.t: Ms. Calbert says: "Blogs and news servers have a unique opportunity to help following disasters because the base of any disaster management effort is integration, communication and working together, 3 things that blogs can help spread information about."
pair.h: The Rapid Disaster Response Blog helps following information on disaster response.

pair.t: The Rapid Disaster Response Blog is meant to help spread information on earthquake disasters, earthquake disaster planning scenario, earthquake disaster plans, Missouri flooding, Mississippi river flooding, evaluating your disaster response, free market responses to disaster and war and more!
pair.h: The Rapid Disaster Response Blog helps following information on disaster response.

pair.t: 50% of Ireland's 1.5 million dwellings were built prior to the introduction of Building Regulations in Ireland in 1979. Energy consumption in Irish homes is about 40% higher than the European average and Irish homes are responsible for a staggering 11.5 million tonnes of CO2 emissions per year.
pair.h: The EU-funded project audited existing social housing schemes in counties Meath, Kildare and Dublin.

pair.t: It is expected that the result of these projects, along with the analysis of social housing schemes in Ireland, will have a European wide impact, will contribute to the exchange and sharing of knowledge and experience in the field and will improve the energy performance of the existing social housing stock and its inhabitants' quality of life.
pair.h: A social housing energy audit is going to be launched in Cork.

pair.t: After many hours of hard work, Welsh Farm Organics have a brand new web-site. They would like to invite you to its grand opening. You can have a look at their website and tell them what you think. They want you to tell them what you think is good and what is bad about their new site. They want to hear what they could add to make your life easier. They have a few ideas but the rest of the staff have persuaded the boss to come up with ideas first. They also want to know if something is confusing.
pair.h: Welsh Farm Organics has a new website where visitors can leave their opinions.

pair.t: Bonin Architects & Associates, PLLC., a national architectural firm specializing in timber frame design and sustainable (green) designs, announces the start of a new post and beam / timber frame blog which will focus on post and beam and timber frame design, structural insulated panels, as well as building costs and energy efficient material options.
pair.h: Green architect Jeremy Bonin creates a blog for timber frame homes.

pair.t: In addition to energy efficient design and materials, the timber frame blog will feature information and tips relating to the construction of a timber frame home, including how to find a general contractor, when to start the design process, and managing your home project.
pair.h: Green architect Jeremy Bonin creates a blog for timber frame homes.

pair.t: Lady Bird Johnson was thrust into the limelight on a November day in 1963. Most Americans remember where they were when President John F Kennedy was assassinated. Few were more profoundly affected by the events of that fateful day than Lady Bird Johnson - wife of Vice-President Lyndon Baines Johnson.
pair.h: Lady Bird Johnson, the first lady who championed beatification, died at 94.

pair.t: Lady Bird Johnson, the former first lady who championed conservation and worked tenaciously for the political career of her husband, Lyndon B. Johnson, died Wednesday, a family spokeswoman said. She was 94.
pair.h: Lady Bird Johnson, the first lady who championed conservation, died at 94.

pair.t: Keng is a trafficker - a trafficker of children, into prostitution, mostly for Western men. She herself was trafficked, says my researcher, and she is just as much of a victim, he argues, as the children she traffics.
pair.h: Thailand is caught up in the child trafficking industry.

pair.t: Prey Vang Province is one of the poorest regions in Cambodia. It is easy to cross from there into Thailand so each year thousands of children are trafficked across the border, often by parents.
pair.h: Thailand is caught up in the child trafficking industry.

pair.t: Originally called the Reform Treaty, the Lisbon Treaty was drawn up to replace the draft European constitution after it was thrown out by voters in France and the Netherlands in 2005.
pair.h: Leaders of the European Union's 27 member states met in Portugal to sign what will now become known as the Lisbon Treaty.

pair.t: The Lisbon Treaty was signed in the Portuguese capital by leaders of the EU's 27 member states in December 2007.
pair.h: Leaders of the European Union's 27 member states met in Portugal to sign what will now become known as the Lisbon Treaty.

pair.t: There was confusion about where people could smoke. Kenya's High Court has suspended a controversial ban on smoking in public places which began on Monday.
pair.h: Kenya suspends a public smoking ban.

pair.t: The ban ordered the suspension for 30 days after tobacco companies challenged the health minister's authority to impose the restriction.
pair.h: Kenya suspends a public smoking ban.

pair.t: Since Monday, the BBC's Noel Mwakugu in Nairobi says some of Kenya's 5m smokers have been in a state of panic, looking for somewhere safe to light up. Under the ban, those caught smoking in offices, bus stations, airports and sports venue would face a fine of 50,000 Kenya shillings ($700; £375) or six months in prison. Bars and restaurants without separate smoking areas were also to be affected.
pair.h: Those found smoking at bus stations, in markets or on the streets, face a fine of $70 or six months in jail.

pair.t: Last year, Director of Medical Services (DMS) James Nyikal said tobacco killed some 12,000 Kenyans each year and a public ban would reduce that figure.
pair.h: A ban on smoking in public places is being enforced in Kenya.

pair.t: British Transport Police dog Vinnie was deployed at Russell Square Tube site where he searched the tunnel to King's Cross.
pair.h: Police dog searched for explosives at Russell Square Tube.

pair.t: Much of the world has moved toward democracy and freedom, but China hasn't moved much and Russia seems headed in the opposite direction. Of the two, China is probably easier to deal with. It appears to have a collective leadership, which gives a certain continuity to its policy.
pair.h: China and Russia will move toward democracy.

pair.t: Obama and Clinton tackle Iraq on the Iowa stump; the candidates criticize the war as the Senate prepares to vote on withdrawal proposals.
pair.h: Clinton proposes the withdrawal of troops from Iraq.

pair.t: The United States took another step in restoring normal diplomatic relations with Libya on Wednesday when President Bush nominated a U.S. ambassador to the once-outcast nation.
pair.h: Bush nominates a U.S. ambassador to Libya.

pair.t: The phrase "staycation" comes from America (where else?) and describes a holiday spent at or near your home. Rising prices, huge fuel surcharges for flights abroad and a slowing economy could see a record number of Britons holidaying at home in 2008.
pair.h: There is a new trend towards making holidays at home.

pair.t: Total Eye Care, a leading eye care provider in the Dallas / Fort Worth Metroplex with offices in Colleyville and Keller, Texas, announces the launch of their new Blog, The Eye Doc Blog. The intended audience is for all patients that want a resource for up to date eye care information.
pair.h: Total Eye Care announces a new blog for the latest news in eye care.

pair.t: On July 7 and again on July 23, there were accidental leaks at the Tricastin Nuclear Power Center in France. This has prompted the Commission for Independent Research and Information on Radioactivity (Criirad) to order a review of security and safety. Already last week, Environment Minister Jean-Louis Borloo said the ground water near all reactors should be tested and the state of waste storage sites assessed.
pair.h: Two nuclear leaks trigger security and safety reviews in France.

pair.t: On Friday, a bomb exploded at a junction in the strip, killing five Hamas operatives along with a six year old girl. Another 15 bystanders were wounded. Hamas movement's armed wing, Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades told reporters that it was unknown who attacked the car on the Gaza coastal road, adding that all of the passengers, including five Hamas militants, were killed.
pair.h: Hamas arrests 200 Palestinians.

pair.t: A Boeing 747-438, Qantas airways flight number QF30 from London, England to Melbourne, Australia, had to make an emergency landing at Ninoy Aquino International Airport in Manila after a door panel popped open, creating a massive hole in the plane's fuselage.
pair.h: A hole in the fuselage caused a Qantas flight to make an emergency landing.

pair.t: A wax model of British singer Amy Winehouse was unveiled on Wednesday at Madame Tussauds in London. The model, at nearly six feet tall and clad in a yellow dress with a microphone in hand, is said to bear a strong likeness to the singer. Her tattoos have even been reproduced to the last detail, including one of a lightning bolt.
pair.h: An Amy Winehouse wax model was unveiled.

pair.t: More than a hundred protestors gathered Saturday in San Francisco to object to the Human Rights Campaign's stance on gender identity. The protestors picketed the HRC's annual fundraising dinner to protest the organization's efforts to remove gender identity protections from legislation that would add sexual orientation to the Employment Non-Discrimination Act (ENDA).
pair.h: Over 100 people protested outside a HRC dinner against the exclusion of gender identity protection from ENDA.

pair.t: Clad in a variety of outfits ranging from street clothing to over-the-top drag to camp gear, wearing make-up, fake mustaches, boys and girls dressed as boys, girls, gays, lesbians, transgendered and gender nonspecific, the group claimed a unified purpose: express just how much they felt betrayed by the HRC's action, a move they argued is opposed by over 350 local, statewide and national LGBT advocacy organizations.
pair.h: Over 100 people protested outside a HRC dinner against the exclusion of gender identity protection from ENDA.

pair.t: Google, known as a popular international search engine, has servers all around the world to index the pages. With the rapid development of the Internet, the number of web pages with unique URL (Uniform Resource Locator) is growing by several billion per day alone. Back in 1998, Google had an index of about only 26 million pages. Within 10 years, the number increased over 38 thousand times.
pair.h: Google's search index hits one trillion pages per day.

pair.t: One out of every four United States bridges needs repairs and updating according to the American Association of State Highway and Transportation Officials (AASHTO).
