The total estimated cost of repairs is US$140 billion, and will continue to rise if not dealt with immediately, according to the report published by AASHTO.
pair.h: A report says modernizing and repairing US bridges will cost $140 billion.

pair.t: The necessity for bridge repairs has been just one of the infrastructure needs for which federal assistance has been requested by some state officials. Governor Ed Rendell of Pennsylvania said that, "we need federal intervention, and federal intervention at a big level."
pair.h: A report says modernizing and repairing US bridges needs federal intervention.

pair.t: A new study shows that a variation in a gene known as the Duffy antigen receptor for chemokines, or simply DARC, may introduce an unknown vulnerability that could lead to a 40% greater risk of contracting HIV, the precursor to AIDS.
pair.h: The African HIV prevalence may also be physiological.

pair.t: Conservative Party leader David Cameron was last night a victim of crime following the theft of his bicycle. The Leader of the Opposition in the United Kingdom was out shopping in West London when the incident happened at around 6:30 last night. He was said to have chained the bike to a short bollard while he picked up some groceries in Tesco on Portobello Road. When he came out, the bike along with its chain had vanished.
pair.h: UK opposition leader David Cameron's bicycle was stolen.

pair.t: According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS), a magnitude 5.4 earthquake struck southern California in the Chino Hills area (San Bernardino County) near Los Angeles California, east of Highway 142. It occurred at about 11:42 a.m. (PDT), and lasted approximately one minute.
pair.h: An earthquake, of magnitude 5.4, struck southern California.

pair.t: United Kingdom flag carrier British Airways (BA) has entered into merger talks with Spanish airline Iberia Lineas Aereas de Espana SA. BA is already Europe's third-largest airline.
pair.h: The Spanish airline Iberia Lineas Aereas de Espana SA is Europe's third-largest airline.

pair.t: United States Senator Ted Stevens of Alaska has been indicted by a federal grand jury on seven criminal counts for making false statements in his Senate financial disclosure forms. The longest-serving Republican in the Senate, Stevens is the highest-profile politician ensnared in the corruption scandal surrounding VECO Corporation and its executives' attempts to influence politics.
pair.h: Alaska senator Ted Stevens was indicted in a corruption scandal.

pair.t: The President of the United States, George W. Bush, has approved the death sentence of an Army Private convicted of multiple rapes and murders. Pvt. Ronald A. Gray, stationed at Fort Bragg in North Carolina at the time, was found guilty in courts-martial for the rape and murder of Pvt. Laura Lee Vickery-Clay, a fellow soldier at Fort Bragg, and civilian taxi driver Kimberly Ann Ruggles. He was also convicted of rape and attempted murder in the case of another Army Pvt. Mary Ann Lang Nameth.
pair.h: The United States confirms the first military death sentence since 1957.

pair.t: United States Presidential hopeful Barack Obama, spoke to over 200,000 last Thursday in Berlin, Germany at Tiergarten Park. His speech was focused on building a stronger connection with Germany and Europe. Obama also called for German troops to be deployed to Afghanistan, and for greater German participation in international crises.
pair.h: US presidential candidate Obama speaks in Berlin, Germany.

pair.t: Puffin numbers are declining on the Farne Islands, where the United Kingdom's largest colony resides. During the past five years, the puffin population on the islands has decreased by a third. Experts had expected numbers to rise this year, but now with news of the decline, are citing an inability to find food as the probable cause.
pair.h: Puffin numbers are falling on the UK's Farne Islands.

pair.t: Five of the six defendants accused of manslaughter over the 2006 fire on board Egyptian ferry al-Salam Boccaccio 98 have been cleared of all charges. The February 3 fire and subsequent sinking killed 1,034 of around 1,400 passengers.
pair.h: Five of the six people accused over the Egyptian ferry fire that killed over 1,000 are acquitted.

pair.t: Mamdouh Ismail, owner of the al-Salam company, his son and three company executives were all cleared of manslaughter over the 2006 fire on board of the Egyptian ferry. Ismail is a member of parliament directly appointed by the president, and both he, his son and another of the executives were tried in absentia as they have left the country. They had all been charged with manslaughter stemming from safety violations on the ship.
pair.h: Five of the six people accused over the Egyptian ferry fire are acquitted.

pair.t: Four months and 3,200 kilometres ago, Canadian runner Jonathan Howard began his run across the second-largest country in the world, to raise awareness for Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). A graduate of McMaster University, Howard arrived in Toronto this week, to address the nation's largest city before continuing his westward run which will take him through all ten Canadian provinces.
pair.h: A marathon runner arrived in Toronto, bringing attention to autism.

pair.t: Clark Rockefeller, a former director of the Algonquin Club in Boston, Massachusetts, has allegedly abducted his 7-year-old daughter, Reigh Boss, during a weekend visit supervised by a social worker. Rockefeller got away in a black SUV, affixed with Red Sox stickers, driven by another man. Authorities believe that Rockefeller might try to escape to Bermuda from New York City on his recently purchased yacht, "Serenity".
pair.h: A US father kidnaps his daughter and may flee from the country on his yacht.

pair.t: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) placed a ban on Iraq's participation on July 24 in the Beijing Olympics claiming a political influence within Iraq's national Olympic committee. This came after the Iraqi government's suspension of the National Olympic Committee (NOC) of Iraq in May 2008.
pair.h: The IOC lifts a ban on Beijing athletes participating in the Beijing Olympics.

pair.t: Biomaxx Systems Inc. (Other OTC: BMXSF), is pleased to announce the company has renewed our membership with the European Federation of Biotechnology (EFB). Biomaxx Systems Inc. is currently the only Canadian company that is an Institutional member of EFB.
pair.h: BioMaxx renews its European Federation of Biotechnology membership.

pair.t: Thin From Within Kids (www.thinfromwithinkids.com) helps overweight children through the power of the Internet, multimedia, and books. The approach suggests that diets, pills, and surgeries may not be the right approach to resolve childhood obesity.
pair.h: According to Thin From Within Kids, diets, pills, and surgeries are the right approach to resolve childhood obesity.

pair.t: Renting a yacht for various family occasions and also for corporate get together is increasingly gaining in popularity. Yacht charters are especially geared toward weddings, birthdays, anniversaries, special occasions, and for business or pleasure.
pair.h: Orca Yacht Charters offers the largest fleet of luxury yachts in Southern California for all kinds of events.

pair.t: Hmedicine.com is an online store selling homeopathic remedies. Hmedicine.com also offers other natural health products to complement the consumers' homeopathic purchases.
pair.h: A homeopathic medicine website wins a prestigious award.

pair.t: Radovan Karadzic, the former Bosnian Serb leader accused of genocide, is hoping to delay his extradition until after a nationalist rally in Belgrade this evening in the face of government attempts to spirit him away immediately to The Hague.
pair.h: Karadzic opposes his extradition until after a rally in Belgrade.

pair.t: A newlywed doctor has been shot dead on her honeymoon and her husband critically injured in a suspected robbery on the Caribbean island of Antigua.
pair.h: A honeymoon couple died in Antigua.

pair.t: About 3,000 blank passports and visas have been stolen while being transported from Manchester to London. The documents were in a van which was targeted on Monday morning.
pair.h: Thousands of blank British passports have been stolen in a raid on a delivery van.

pair.t: More than 40 women typhoid sufferers were locked up for life in a mental asylum to prevent them spreading the disease, according to newly-found records.
pair.h: Typhoid victims were locked up for life in a mental institution.

pair.t: Researchers at Newcastle University found that people with late-onset, or type 2 diabetes could improve their body's ability to store sugar and burn fat by walking at lunchtime, or before or after work.
pair.h: Diabetics can help control their condition by walking an extra 45 minutes a day.

pair.t: Researchers at Newcastle University found that people with late-onset, or type 2 diabetes could improve their body's ability to store sugar and burn fat by walking at lunchtime, or before or after work.
pair.h: Diabetics can help control their condition by walking.

pair.t: British Airways and Iberia, the Spanish flag carrier, announced today that they are seeking a merger that would create one of Europe's largest airlines.
pair.h: British Airways and Iberia confirm merger talks.

pair.t: Dell has unveiled a range of miniature PCs that it hopes will appeal to anyone looking to minimise their electricity consumption and maximise their desktop space.
pair.h: Dell releases mini desktops.

pair.t: Militants killed three army intelligence men in an ambush and also took hostage 30 police and paramilitary soldiers in a raid on their post earlier this week.
pair.h: Pakistani forces killed over 25 militants in Swat.

pair.t: A dyslexic medical student is taking legal action to end the use of multiple choice exams in her training because she claims the system is unfair.
pair.h: Naomi Gadian, 21, from Manchester, said multiple choice discriminated against people with dyslexia and should be scrapped.

pair.t: MOORS: Murder victim Keith Bennett's mum last night prayed for an end to her agony after bones were found at a beauty spot. The remains were found on Saddleworth Moor, where Ian Brady and Myra Hindley buried their victims.
pair.h: Moors murder victim's bones have been found after 44 years.

pair.t: Anti-knife crime campaigners condemned the application, details of which emerged barely a week after the British Crime Survey found that more than 350 knife crime offences were being committed in the country every day.
pair.h: Anti-knife campaign group Urban Concepts praised the shank application.

pair.t: Honda has released the first official images of the new Jazz. Honda claims its new Jazz will build on the qualities that made the old model so popular in the UK.
pair.h: The new-generation Honda Jazz goes on sale in the UK.

pair.t: Seven years after the bandages last came off, actor Brendan Fraser returns in The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor as archaeologist Rick O'Connell, this time retired, and with a grown-up son Alex.
pair.h: Brendan Fraser refused the role of Rick O'Connell in the third chapter of the successful Mummy films.

pair.t: Duffy has apparently revealed she isn't worried about kids illegally downloading music - as it will encourage more of them to buy records in the long run.
pair.h: Duffy has criticized kids who download music illegally.

pair.t: Scully and Mulder are back. Gillian Anderson and David Duchovny - who reprise their roles as FBI agents investigating the paranormal - got a warm reception from excited fans in London as they presented The X-Files: I Want To Believe this week.
pair.h: Gillian and her screen partner David re-open 'X Files'.

pair.t: Another rare loggerhead turtle has been washed up on UK shores. He has been called Flash.
pair.h: A rare loggerhead turtle was found at Ogmore by Sea.

pair.t: A man on a Greyhound bus travelling across the Canadian Prairies has killed and decapitated a fellow passenger.
pair.h: Children see a man decapitate a fellow passenger on a Greyhound bus in Canada.

pair.t: An eyewitness said the victim was stabbed 50 or 60 times by the man sitting next to him, who then severed his head with a large knife.
pair.h: An eyewitness said the victim has been shot dead.

pair.t: YouTube gang rape scenes have been deleted in an attempt to police the dark side of digital.
pair.h: A YouTube video of alleged gang rape was viewed 600 times before being removed from the site.

pair.t: YouTube, the video-sharing website, is under attack from MPs for failing to prevent images of sex and violence being posted freely on the internet.
pair.h: YouTube has been attacked by MPs over sex and violence footage.

pair.t: Former Blue Peter presenter Peter Purves has been taken to hospital after a dog bit his hand during a dog show. The terrier became annoyed while having its teeth and coat inspected during the show at a garden centre in Norwich. Purves was taken to the Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital for treatment to the gash on his hand.
pair.h: A presenter has been bitten by a dog at a show.

pair.t: Former Blue Peter presenter Peter Purves has been taken to hospital after a dog bit his hand during a dog show. The terrier became annoyed while having its teeth and coat inspected during the show at a garden centre in Norwich. Purves was taken to the Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital for treatment to the gash on his hand.
pair.h: Peter Purves has been taken to hospital after a dog bit his foot.

pair.t: The public opinion organization, The Standard Eurobarometer 67, found some 65 percent of the Romanians trust the EU, and the "satisfaction with everyday life" in Romania on a short term stands at 43 percent and on a medium term with 57 percent, exceeding the average level registered in the union. The trust in the EU saw a surprising growth pace both in the old member states (from 42 percent to 55 percent) and in the new ones (from 59 percent to 66 percent).
pair.h: Trust in the Standard Eurobarometer is growing both in the old and in the new member states.

pair.t: More products are being imported to the US from China than ever before - but a series of scares has left some wondering whether they are safe.
pair.h: China exports the majority of its products to the US.

pair.t: Mold grows on wet and damp areas, usually in bathrooms, kitchens and the laundry area. It produces allergens and irritants; when inhaled or touched, it can cause allergic reactions to sensitive people. Dryer Vent Wizard educates consumers on awareness of mold in their clothes dryer vent.
pair.h: Mold also grows in clothes dryer vents.

pair.t: "MP3-player is a superb product that everyone should try," says Bill Conwell, IPT SVP of Business Development, "and we're proud to be associated with Stulz in promoting this superb technology."
pair.h: Conwell works in Business Development.

pair.t: A new study shows how deeply some Roomba owners become attached to the robotic vacuums, and suggests there's a measure of public readiness to accept robots in the house - even flawed ones.
pair.h: Roomba is a vacuum.

pair.t: Grinter decided to study the devices after she saw online pictures of people dressing up their Roombas, the disc-shaped, self-directed vacuums made by Burlington, Mass-based iRobot Corp.
pair.h: Grinter has a Roomba.

pair.t: Democrats struggling to win increases in health and education programs paired them Thursday with a popular budget bill for veterans, but President Bush held the upper hand in a veto showdown.
pair.h: Bush is the president of Democrats.

pair.t: Democrats struggling to win increases in health and education programs paired them Thursday with a popular budget bill for veterans, but President Bush held the upper hand in a veto showdown.
pair.h: President Bush is a veteran.

pair.t: Lady Bird Johnson was the wife of the 36th president of the United States, Lyndon Baines Johnson.
pair.h: Johnson's wife was 36 years old when her husband became President.

pair.t: The deliveryman, Brian Wells, 46, had told police before the bomb exploded in August 2003 that he was an innocent victim and had been forced by gunmen to rob the bank.
pair.h: The delivery man robbed a bank.

pair.t: Capital Associated Industries, Inc, (CAI), the largest membership employers' association in the state, is working on a lobbying campaign to influence state lawmakers to vote against HS 1583, an act to give unions the ability to negotiate with state and local government.
pair.h: CAI lobbies against public employee unions.

pair.t: Lawyers and attorneys consumer advocate, Marilyn Santerre, has partnered with Neekam company to create the Lawyers 747 Blog.
pair.h: A legal eagle starts the Lawyers 747 Blog.

pair.t: Legal Advantage is pleased to announce it has formalized a "Customer Bill of Rights" designed to solidify Legal Advantage's continued commitment to its clients and ensure an enhanced customer experience in all aspects of its business and services.
pair.h: Legal Advantage destroyed the "Customer Bill of Rights".

pair.t: The new neuro-cognitive therapy focuses upon attempting to train the brain to process incoming sensory stimulation in a more normal manner and consists of providing structured sensory information, within an environment which has been adapted to take account of the child's developmental difficulties.
pair.h: A new therapy focuses upon children's developmental problems.

pair.t: Ayushveda presents an exclusive Diet and Fitness online magazine for all those fitness freaks out there. India's largest health portal recently announced the launch of the online magazine that is targeted towards a global audience.
pair.h: India has a health portal where there is an online diet and fitness magazine.

pair.t: For all of the Western men out there looking for love, Be Happy International has developed a fantastic online solution. The company is a dating and marriage agency that brings Russian women to Western men online in an interactive online environment.
pair.h: Be Happy International brings Russian brides online.

pair.t: The HYDROXYCUT is a revolutionary product formulated by Muscletech Research & Development, Inc. The ingredients in Hydroxycut have been shown in scientific studies to support thermogenesis and energy metabolism.
pair.h: The ingredients in Hydroxycut are natural.

pair.t: If you are in need of a pair of affordable shoes, a mismatched pair of shoes or a single shoe in a certain style then Kent Basson has a deal for you. Basson founded Odd Shoe Finder.com on the internet to help people who need odd sized shoes or who are handicapped or injured.
pair.h: Basson has founded a site where you can buy an odd pair of shoes.

pair.t: Dr. Mayra Alfonso, a medical doctor, on her website http://www.freedogtrainingcd.com/ has provided the 'Insider Secrets' to train your dog with positive reinforcement, and avoid all those outdated negative dog training techniques that make your dog suffer.
pair.h: Having a well behaved dog without hiring a professional dog trainer is possible with the "Insider Secrets", a free site.

pair.t: San Francisco based Craigslist Foundation, along with more than 1,000 nonprofit leaders and social entrepreneurs, is scheduled to commandeer the NYU campus on August 16, 2008. Craigslist Foundation, a nonprofit organization formed by the creators of Craigslist.org, provides free and low cost programs for nonprofit professionals and social entrepreneurs.
pair.h: Craigslist Foundation gives free basic training for nonprofits.

pair.t: The mission of National Charity Services is to provide logistical and managerial support to non-profits in order to help them to achieve maximum profitability from all fund raising efforts.
pair.h: National Charity Services donates cars to help non-profit organizations.

pair.t: The Four Pearls of Beckstrand Cancer Foundation, which aims to improve and enhance the quality of life of children, teens and families struggling with cancer, today announced the launch of its new Art Therapy Support Group. The new program will teach adolescents with cancer how to better cope with their diagnosis and prognosis, and aid in their recovery.
pair.h: Four Pearls of Beckstrand Cancer Foundation launches a new adolescent Art Gallery.

pair.t: Zapanta learned that he might be able to sleep a little easier while he is at home, because the Coalition to Salute America's Heroes, CSAH, the leading nongovernmental provider of emergency financial aid to severely wounded troops from the War on Terror, and Craftmatic® Adjustable Beds are donating a bed to the Veteran, free-of-charge because of his service.
pair.h: A veteran hopes that a bed donation will help him cope with restless nights.

pair.t: Make Anything Work was founded on one simple principle: to do everything possible to help entrepreneurs and small business owners beat the odds and build successful businesses. As part of that goal, Make Anything Work Holdings Inc. has announced Junior Achievement of British Columbia as the first recipient of their "Make Giving Back Work" program.
pair.h: Make Anything Work announces that no one will receive the "Make Giving Back Work" program.

pair.t: Dr. Michael Nobel never did introduce himself as chairman of the Nobel Family Society which the organizers of Nanotech had stated in their previous press-release. He clearly stated that he was the actual chairman of the Nobel Charitable Trust Foundation (which he in fact is) and proposed to make the announcement of these new awards in that name.
pair.h: The Nobel Charitable Trust Foundation chairman prefers to introduce himself as chairman of the Nobel Family Society.

pair.t: Another Prominent Republican has switched sides and joined the Obama Camp. Mr. Kaweske received the National Republican Business Man of the Year award in 2005 as well as served under the appointment of Jeb Bush on the Florida Development Finance Corporation.
pair.h: Kaweske opposes Barrack Obama for President.

pair.t: Political analyst Earl Ofari Hutchinson says Barack Obama has to capture the votes of Latinos for his Democratic presidential bid in the March 4 Texas primary.
pair.h: Latino voters are crucial for Obama in Texas.

pair.t: Hillary Clinton, John McCain, Barack Obama and other presidential candidates are now prime targets to be pelted with tomatoes. Now you can hurl a tomato at your favorite political pundit and score a direct hit for the Republicans or the Democrats.
pair.h: People can pelt tomatoes at a Presidential candidate.

pair.t: Transwide is glad to announce the Launch of "MarCo", its Ocean Container transport execution module extension. "MarCo" allows you to completely process your container ocean shipments electronically, while reducing risk of miscommunication.
pair.h: Transwide officially launches "MarCo".

pair.t: VillaCentre, the UK's leading direct specialist agent for unpackaged quality today announced plans to install new energy efficient air conditioning units throughout their portfolio of luxury villas. The air conditioning units will be fitted across 120 villas in France, Spain and Portugal. Although the project is expected to cost 64,000 Euros in total, the units will be installed at no cost to villa owners.
pair.h: VillaCentre announces a E64,000 air conditioning investment to be paid by villa owners.

pair.t: After two decades of serving happy clients in London, Stretchlimos.co.uk has now expanded its limousine hire services to Berkshire, Buckinghamshire, Hampshire, Hertfordshire, Middlesex & Surrey.
pair.h: Stretchlimos.co.uk opens new branches in various counties to expand their UK presence.

pair.t: Worldwide Industrial Marketplace (WIM), an e-commerce trade site for buyers and suppliers of industrial goods throughout Asia and the Middle East, announced last night the launch of its new water treatment equipment directory now available on the company's Web site.
pair.h: It was announced that new water treatment systems and equipment directory are to be sold door-to-door.

pair.t: RHUB Communications, Inc. (RHUB) announced today that Info Security Products Guide, a Silicon Valley Communications publication focusing on security-related products and technologies, has named RHUB's TurboMeeting 200 On-Premise Web conferencing appliance winner of the 2008 Global Product Excellence in World's Best Software Customer Trust Award.
pair.h: RHUB TurboMeeting 200 gains the highest trust of customers worldwide.

pair.t: Synchronica plc, an international provider of mobile email and synchronization solutions, has raised an additional USD 3.9 million to further fund its push into emerging markets with its mobile email and backup solutions.
pair.h: Synchronica brings 2008 funding to $7.5 million to capitalize on mobile email opportunities in emerging markets.

pair.t: My Global Image LLC, announces the future of online networking through video streaming technology with the launch of www.HelloDemoTour.com.
pair.h: My Global Image LLC is the new leader in online video streaming.

pair.t: Peter Partridge is responsible for all communications and interactions with clients, helping them to maximise their use of Soutron software solutions and to capitalise on their investment.
pair.h: Soutron introduces a new client manager position, held by Peter Partridge.

pair.t: A mower which cuts the grass by itself is being marketed by a Co. Meath entrepreneur, Patrick McCann.
pair.h: A mower cuts the grass 100% automatically.

pair.t: Apart from being a research tool, Monkiri plans to make it a collaborative research tool and a knowledge-sharing community and social content site.
pair.h: A new research tool can improve productivity online.

pair.t: Designed by XPLANE, the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), has published 'A World Fit For Us', an illustrated report for young people that details the state of, and progress around, some of the world's most pressing issues through the personal stories of 19 youth.
pair.h: XPLANE has created an illustrated report for UNICEF.

pair.t: Pet owners and animal rescue organizations have discovered Fundable.com as a way to generate funds for suffering dogs and cats. Fundable.com is a web site that provides simple online fundraising tools.
pair.h: A web site has been founded to provide fundraising tools to help sick pets.

pair.t: Two Australian Bishops have given Catholic Matchmaker NZ permission to promote within their Dioceses, with others considering the option. This means that Australian Single Catholics may now search online for friends and a marriage partner.
pair.h: Catholic Matchmaker NZ expands to Australia.

pair.t: IMGENEX is pleased to announce that it has signed an exclusive distribution agreement with Dendritics SAS (Dardilly, France) to make their portfolio of highly characterized and validated monoclonal Dendritic cell research antibodies available to researchers in North America and India.
pair.h: IMGENEX is the exclusive North American distributor for Dendritics.

pair.t: IMGENEX is pleased to announce that it has signed an exclusive distribution agreement with Dendritics SAS (Dardilly, France) to make their portfolio of highly characterized and validated monoclonal Dendritic cell research antibodies available to researchers in North America and India.
pair.h: IMGENEX has announced it is no more the exclusive North American distributor for Dendritics.

pair.t: Online PR and marketing firm PressReleasePoint reported major drop in revenue and traffic as a result of change in website IP address.
pair.h: Online PR loses business after a simple SEO mistake.

pair.t: Radovan Karadzic, the Bosnian Serb genocide criminal, went into a jail cell in the Netherlands this morning awaiting trial on 11 charges of war crimes, after being whisked from Belgrade to The Hague in the middle of the night.
pair.h: Karadzic was extradited to The Hague for war crimes, in particular for genocide.

pair.t: Barring last-minute changes, President Thabo Mbeki will visit Zimbabwe today for crucial meetings with that country's main political parties and their leaders involved in power-sharing talks, in a bid to clear hurdles to a final agreement.
pair.h: Mbeki is on a mission in Zimbabwe to clear talks hurdles.

pair.t: The moderate earthquake that struck the Los Angeles area yesterday underscores the importance of preparation to prevent damage, death and injuries in the event of a bigger temblor, officials said.
pair.h: A moderate quake in Los Angeles highlights the need for preparation.

pair.t: The indictment of Sen. Ted Stevens (R-Alaska) on corruption charges Tuesday throws into question his grip on a Senate seat he has held for decades and offers Democrats a chance to strengthen their hold on Congress.
pair.h: Ted Stevens will have to leave his Senate seat.

pair.t: Several national restaurant chains were shuttered on Tuesday, possibly offering an early taste of what's in store this year for businesses that depend on free-spending consumers whose budgets are now being squeezed.
pair.h: Restaurant chains close for a strike on Tuesday.

pair.t: Several national restaurant chains were shuttered on Tuesday, possibly offering an early taste of what's in store this year for businesses that depend on free-spending consumers whose budgets are now being squeezed.
pair.h: Restaurant chains close because diners reduce their spending.

pair.t: Investigators looking at whether an exploding oxygen bottle blew a large hole in the side of a Qantas 747 said on Wednesday part of a bottle burst into the plane's cabin and partly moved a door lock.
pair.h: An oxygen bottle exploded in the Qantas 747 cabin in the course of a terrorist attack.

pair.t: A start-up led by former star Google engineers on Sunday unveiled a new Web search service, Cuil, that aims to outdo the Internet search leader in size, but faces an uphill battle changing Web surfing habits.
pair.h: Former Googleers unveil a new search engine Cuil.

pair.t: A start-up led by former star Google engineers on Sunday unveiled a new Web search service, Cuil, that aims to outdo the Internet search leader in size, but faces an uphill battle changing Web surfing habits.
pair.h: Former Googleers unveil a new search engine Cuil, created with the technology stolen from Google.

pair.t: For the first time, a drug has shown promise for halting the progression of Alzheimer's disease by breaking up the protein tangles that clog victims' brains.
pair.h: A drug can treat Alzheimer's.

pair.t: A law that would bar fast-food restaurants from opening in South Los Angeles for at least a year sailed through the Los Angeles City Council on Tuesday. The council approved the fast-food moratorium unanimously.
pair.h: The council bans new fast-food outlets in South L.A.

pair.t: Colorado health officials said they had found a Salmonella-tainted jalapeno in the home of someone sickened in a recent outbreak of the food poisoning - a vital clue in tracking down the source of the illness.
pair.h: Colorado experts find Salmonella in jalapeno.

pair.t: A Briton accused of hacking into top secret military computers has lost a Law Lords appeal against being extradited to stand trial in the US.
pair.h: A hacker loses extradition appeal.

pair.t: Cruelty to animals is rising fast in Britain's "affluent, throwaway society," the RSPCA said in a report on Wednesday.
pair.h: Cruelty to animals is rising, because Britain is a "throwaway" society.

pair.t: Barack Obama met privately Tuesday with a group of women leaders, seeking their endorsement and also raising a sore point - the issue of gender bias in his Democratic primary fight with Hillary Rodham Clinton.
pair.h: Obama meets with a group of women for ambiguous reasons.

pair.t: After spending much of the summer searching for an effective line of attack against Senator Barack Obama, Senator John McCain is beginning a newly aggressive campaign to define Mr. Obama as arrogant, out of touch and unprepared for the presidency.
pair.h: McCain tries to define Obama as out of touch.

pair.t: After spending much of the summer searching for an effective line of attack against Senator Barack Obama, Senator John McCain is beginning a newly aggressive campaign to define Mr. Obama as arrogant, out of touch and unprepared for the presidency.
pair.h: McCain is defined as arrogant, aggressive and unprepared.

pair.t: The prime minister of Antigua says Britain and the US are partly to blame for a spate of violent attacks that have "nearly overwhelmed" the Caribbean island, including this week's shooting of a British honeymoon couple, Benjamin and Catherine Mullany.
pair.h: Antiguan PM says Britain and US must share the blame for the rise in violent crime.

pair.t: Federal immigration officials on Wednesday revealed more details about an experimental program that will allow unauthorized immigrants to officially self-deport.
pair.h: ICE offers details about a self-deport program.

pair.t: Federal immigration officials on Wednesday revealed more details about an experimental program that will allow unauthorized immigrants to officially self-deport.
pair.h: Now unauthorized immigrants will be able to officially deport their families.

pair.t: Smoking appears to have started a fire that caused $70 million in damage to the nuclear-powered aircraft carrier George Washington, based in Norfolk, Va., naval officials said.
pair.h: Two officers were relieved of duty after a fire on an aircraft carrier.

pair.t: Decades after the surgeon general first warned that cigarettes were a health hazard, the House of Representatives overwhelmingly approved legislation on Wednesday that would for the first time give the Food and Drug Administration the power to regulate tobacco products.
pair.h: The House votes to regulate tobacco as a drug.

pair.t: Congress wants to blow the whistle on colleges that raise tuition sharply, while helping students pay less for textbooks and making Pell grants available year-round - part of a wide-ranging bill designed to address concerns about rising college costs.
pair.h: A wide-ranging bill aims to rein in college costs.

pair.t: Foreign students who miss more than 10 lectures in a row will be reported to the Government under new plans to crack down on illegal immigration.
pair.h: Illegal immigration: Foreign students who miss important lectures will be reported to their countries.

pair.t: San Juan College and Texas A&M University-Commerce have reached an agreement to jointly provide students with a bachelor's degree that can lead to a career in occupational safety.
pair.h: San Juan college offers a degree with Texas A&M.

pair.t: The cleaners grade meeting on Friday 25th July agreed that we will need more strikes to win the strike demands for all cleaners.
pair.h: Cleaners will go on strike on Friday.

pair.t: The Ontario Dental Association is applauding a Health Canada-commissioned report recommending lower levels of fluoride in drinking water.
pair.h: It is recommended that fluoride levels be reduced in drinking water in Ontario.

pair.t: The irrigation department on Wednesday stated that the current 20% water cut for Pune city will continue till the water storage in the dams supplying water to the city reaches a level of 18 TMC.
pair.h: The water cut will stay in place for almost 18 days.

pair.t: Aquacell Water, Inc announced today that it hasn't received a contract valued at $200,000 from the Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) to replace the arsenic removal media in six drinking water treatment systems built by the Company.
pair.h: Aquacell Water receives new funds from the Bureau of Indian Affairs.

pair.t: Aquacell Water, Inc announced today that it hasn't received a contract valued at $200,000 from the Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) to replace the arsenic removal media in six drinking water treatment systems built by the Company.
pair.h: Aquacell Water hasn't received the contract because its price was too high.

pair.t: Local officials and the town engineer met Tuesday with an engineering consultant who specializes in water systems to discuss how to correct the ongoing problem of the presence of total coliform bacteria in the town's water system.
pair.h: Portland is working to rid its water system of bacteria.

pair.t: Every year, Haitians crowd into the basin of a sacred waterfall to relax and pray for a better future.
pair.h: Haiti's Voodoo pilgrims pray for the future.

pair.t: A top government scientist who helped the FBI analyze samples from the 2001 anthrax attacks has died in Maryland from an apparent suicide, just as the Justice Department was about to file criminal charges against him for the attacks, the Los Angeles Times has learned.
pair.h: The anthrax suspect was murdered in his home.

pair.t: A top government scientist who helped the FBI analyze samples from the 2001 anthrax attacks has died in Maryland from a murder, just as the Justice Department was about to file criminal charges against him for the attacks, the Los Angeles Times has learned.
pair.h: The anthrax suspect died in a violent murder.

pair.t: Cannons were fired and church bells rang out as the King of Tonga was crowned monarch of the tiny South Pacific nation today in a ceremony attended by royalty and political leaders from around the world.
pair.h: Cannons fire and bells ring out as the Tongan king is crowned.

pair.t: A man arrested over the theft of 3,000 blank passports and visas worth about £2.5m from a security van in Greater Manchester has been bailed.
pair.h: A man was bailed over the passports theft.

pair.t: Gary McKinnon has vowed to take his case to the European Court of Human Rights, after his appeal against extradition was rejected by the House of Lords yesterday.
pair.h: McKinnon vows to fight on.

pair.t: Police spokeswoman Lenita Alves said: "Carlos has told us that he and Cara argued on Friday after she threatened to go to the police to accuse him of being a drugs trafficker."
pair.h: Carlos was a drugs trafficker.

pair.t: A drunk teenager in a stolen luxury Lexus smashed into a row of parked cars at 107mph, on the first time he'd ever driven.
pair.h: A drunk teenager smashed a stolen car at 107mph.

pair.t: A Porsche driver was yesterday arrested on suspicion of dangerous driving after crashing head-on with an open-top bus which toppled on to its side throwing passengers on to heathland in Studland, Dorset.
pair.h: A Porsche driver crashed into a bus because he was drunk.

pair.t: India is set to clear one of the last three hurdles to its historic nuclear deal with the United States today when the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) approves a mechanism to safeguard and inspect Indian nuclear facilities.
pair.h: India is set to clear a hurdle in a historic US nuclear deal.

pair.t: China's military has deployed tens of thousands of soldiers to safeguard the Olympics from possible terrorist attacks, a senior officer said Friday, saying the gravest danger came from Muslim radicals in western China.
pair.h: China is afraid of a terrorist attack.

pair.t: Scientists at Harvard and Columbia universities reported they had used skin cells from two patients, aged 82 and 89, with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, ALS or Lou Gehrig's disease, and were able to reprogram the cells into a type of adult stem cell, and from that into nerve cells.
pair.h: Scientists succeed in reprogramming stem cells.

pair.t: From the polar bears of the arctic, to the grizzly bears of the Rocky Mountains, global warming has become a very real threat. Now, a new Web site by the name of Bear Planet (http://www.bearplanet.org) has launched with the goal of documenting bear habitats around the world.
pair.h: Global warming endangers bears.

pair.t: "Polar bears aren't the only species in danger," said spokeswoman Gloria Gaccio. "They're just the first species to show obvious signs of change. Grizzly bears, black bears, panda bears... they all stand to lose habitat. Our site aims to provide the latest information on them all."
pair.h: Grizzly bears aren't in danger.

pair.t: As part of the Granada Theatre Restoration Design and Construction Team, Steven Handelman of Steven Handelman Studios designed and manufactured all the decorative lighting for Santa Barbara's completely restored Granada Theatre, which opened in late February 2008.
pair.h: Steven Handelman worked in the Granada Theatre.

pair.t: "Outer Darkness" by Jerry Greene has achieved the impossible: An original and exciting debate of hell, death and darkness in the Bible and beyond. Outer Darkness dissects and examines religious symbolism and translations to uncover the true meanings behind the words.
pair.h: Outer Darkness gives a new interpretation of religious symbolism.

pair.t: Desert Road Publishing is pleased to announce the July 25 launch of David Miguel Estrada's story of Cody Luther, an aging country singer who cut short his career in the 1980's and left for Mexico after his wife cheated on him with Willie Nelson.
pair.h: Desert Road Publishing debuts with 'You Ain't No Johnny Cash'.

pair.t: Buy tickets from TwoStepTix.com to sports, theater, and concert events. We have a huge selection of cheap tickets for concerts, sports, and theater events, Broadway, Las Vegas, and more.
pair.h: TwoStepTix.com sells cheap tickets for concerts, sports, and theater events.

pair.t: Canada's insurance marketplace, released the results of its online QuickPoll survey that asked visitors if they've ever tried to hide the fact they were in an auto accident from someone in their family. One per cent of kanetix.ca visitors said "Yes", they've tried to hide a car accident from a family member.
pair.h: 16 per cent of drivers try to hide a car accident from a family member.

pair.t: More than 47 million people in the United States are not covered by health insurance, despite the fact that it is practically a necessity in today's world. One of the primary reasons for the fact that so many people are uninsured is the fact that the cost of medical insurance is on the rise, and many people simply cannot afford it.
pair.h: Everyone in America has health insurance.

pair.t: Today, http://www.thecheckoutline.org - the first-ever online advice column for the terminally ill and those who are close to them - will appear with a bold new design and a new easily accessible FORUM for readers to discuss their own issues. Launched by award-winning Vanity Fair contributing editor, Judy Bachrach, Thecheckoutline.org has, within one month of its arrival, met with enormous critical acclaim and huge numbers of readers, many of them Boomers writing in for advice.
pair.h: Thecheckoutline.org receives critical acclaim.

pair.t: JBJ is proud to introduce a superb collection of premium quality malachite and raw diamond unisex bracelets in aid of the Diamond United state. This statement piece is now internationally recognized as a symbol of universal support for the American people. The design of the bracelet is a perfect representation of the beliefs and aims to "provide quality" its launch. The green malachite is symbolic of the care of the planet and, in fact, the Americans continent and its natural and human resources.
pair.h: JBJ bracelets are made with green malachite.

pair.t: Even though they've been living millions of years on the Chilean coasts, no one had studied them well enough. Until now, where biologists at the University of Concepcion (Chile), allied with Craig Venter, are researching their potential, ranging from the production of ammonia and hydrogen to creating explosives and drugs. The Chilean seafloor continues to exhibit its great potential. Marine Biologist PhD Victor Ariel Gallardo studies the genome of macrobacteria (Beggiatoa spp.) and megabacteria.
pair.h: Chilean marine megabacteria could be the solution to some types of cancer.

pair.t: Statistics have shown that women who stay home and clean their homes with toxic cleaners have a 54% greater risk of getting cancer than those women who work and hire someone to clean their homes. The 15-year study concluded that this was a direct result of the increased exposure to toxic chemicals, many of which are found in common household products. "I know, because I am a cancer statistic," says Nilsson. "I used those toxic chemicals to clean my home for years and I did get cancer".
pair.h: A 15-year study concluded that toxic household chemicals are making us sick.

pair.t: We are delighted to have opened our first care village at Knightsbridge Village in Trim, County Meath. Knightsbridge Village offers a choice of living options, from a residential care home with exceptional nursing care to houses and home for independent living. A new medical centre will provide on-site health care to residents.
pair.h: Knightsbridge Village offers exceptional nursing care.

pair.t: 080808.com.my has created a Pledge Room for everyone to know that even small actions can contribute in helping planet Earth. The environmental campaign aims to spread awareness of climate change affecting the world and how we can each play our part in preserving the environment. Since its launch recently, it has successfully attracted hundreds of visitors from around the world to its site and to participate in its Pledge Room.
pair.h: 080808.com.my launches an environmental pledge campaign on climate change.

pair.t: Disaster activist, Brenda Calbert, has teamed up with Neekam Inc to create the Rapid Disaster Response Blog. Readers can keep up with the latest news on Florida disaster response, disaster response incident command, disaster response information, disaster response animal rescue and levels of disaster response.
pair.h: An activist started a rapid disaster.

pair.t: Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi is hosting India's premier start-up event Proto.in on 18th and 19th of July. In its fourth edition, Proto.in will witness a rare amalgamation of the entire entrepreneurial ecosystem. In keeping with its mantra of being a platform for start-ups, Proto.in has moved to a different level of experience altogether in this edition.
pair.h: An event for Indian entrepreneurial ecosystem will take place in July.

pair.t: The Dallas Chapter of the American Society for Training & Development (ASTD) offers their annual Southwest Learning Summit and Exposition (SLS) this summer in Texas. The Learning Summit portion provides presentations on new and effective training and development programs or other information relevant to leadership and human resource professionals. The Exposition portion includes vendors who provide training classes, consulting, or learning and organizational development materials.
pair.h: Texas hosts the Annual Southwest Learning Summit and Exposition.

pair.t: The party supply industry is a hot one today, and while many people think of the industry as one geared more towards children, Pinatas.com has seen a huge increase in sales of adult party supplies. Although many supplies geared towards children are offered, this party supply site offers a huge selection of adult party supplies as well, and adults appear to love it, as sales continue to increase for adult party supplies on the site.
pair.h: Children party supply sales increase at Pinatas.com.

pair.t: WealthBridge Connect is hosting a live WebEx training session to help companies increase better sales profitability through increased awareness of the sales process. In this webinar, Joel L Anderson, WealthBridge Connect Co-Founder and Sales Trainer, will explain how to identify the steps in the sales process that deliver real results; create intentional strategies and techniques in your sales plan to reach your desired outcome, and how to get access to a customized sales plan.
pair.h: WealthBridge Connect hosts a sales plan webinar.

pair.t: Shopping for jewelry at TheJewelryDomain.com is truly a unique experience. The high quality images throughout the site illustrate each jewelry item to its finest detail. All jewelry items on the interactive website can be viewed in 360 degree angle, by clicking on the 360-Rotation links that are found throughout the site.
pair.h: Jewelry buying is a unique experience at The Jewelry Domain.

pair.t: Export prices for both pine and Eucalyptus wood chips have gone up substantially in 2008 in Australia as a result of increased demand in Japan and a tighter supply of wood chips throughout the Pacific Rim region, according to the Wood Resource Quarterly.
pair.h: Wood chip export prices are higher in Australia in 2008 as wood supply tightens around the Pacific Rim.

pair.t: WatchIndia.TV is partnering up with the Network of Indian Professionals (NetIP) to offer a new benefit to all NetIP members. Now new and current NetIP members can subscribe to WatchIndia.TV and receive an additional 10% off regular price.
pair.h: NetIP members get the best Indian TV available.

pair.t: In keeping with its mission to help entrepreneurs and business people become more successful, the Sunday Times Enterprise network has joined forces with business TV provider YourBusinessChannel to deliver free, top level business video featuring advice and tips from the world's leading business experts and brands.
pair.h: The Sunday Times audience will get top quality advice through business TV provider YourBusinessChannel.

pair.t: John Muritu is a successful Internet marketer and the internet's most successful and remarkable coach, mentor and leader. John has been involved in the home-based business arena for 10 years during which he has been very successful helping clients build their online businesses. Cruise To Cash is without doubt today the internet's fastest growing opportunity.
pair.h: Top mentor John Muritu endorses Cruise To Cash, a big business for internet users.

pair.t: Proposals to extend the Dubai Metro to neighbouring Ajman are currently being discussed. The plans, still in the early stages, would be welcome news for investors who own properties in Ajman.
pair.h: Dubai Metro will be expanded.

pair.t: OPPORTUNITY: If you are over the age of 19 and would like to participate in a punk music video, please contact MAX Agency by tomorrow at 3pm. 15 individuals will be chosen for a taping taking place Wednesday May 21 for 4-5 hours.
pair.h: The Max Agency talent audition follows model audition standards.

pair.t: According to the New York Times, in an ambush occurring Jan. 19 in northern Iraq, outside of Baiji, a British man and an Iraqi security guard were killed and a Brazilian contractor was kidnapped. Both of the men who died in the attack were working for Janusian Security Risk Management of London. The Brazilian man, an engineer, was working for Norberto Odebrecht, South America's largest construction company. His identity was not revealed by the company.
pair.h: An engineer was kidnapped in northern Iraq.

pair.t: According to the New York Times, in an ambush occurring Jan. 19 in northern Iraq, outside of Baiji, a British man and an Iraqi security guard were killed and a Brazilian contractor was kidnapped. Both of the men who died in the attack were working for Janusian Security Risk Management of London. The Brazilian man, an engineer, was working for Norberto Odebrecht, South America's largest construction company. His identity was not revealed by the company.
pair.h: The New York Times is financed by South America's largest construction company.

pair.t: The channel's Canadian roots were cut in 2000 when media mogul Barry Diller snapped up Trio and sister channel News World International from the CBC and partner Power Corp. for $155 million in cash. Diller saw the channel as a cheap consolation prize after he was outbid by NBC for the Bravo cable network earlier that year. Within months, Diller rebranded Trio, dumped the Canadian dramas and geared it more toward edgier pop culture programming.
pair.h: Diller acquired the Bravo cable network.

pair.t: The United States Senate has voted to accept President George W. Bush's nomination of Condoleezza Rice as United States Secretary of State. Eighty-five Senators voted to approve her accession while 13 opposed it. Two Senators did not vote. Ms Rice is expected to be sworn into office in the White House later this evening, with a more elaborate public ceremony on Friday, and to begin her new role on Thursday morning.
pair.h: George W. Bush is an opponent of Condoleezza Rice.

pair.t: New Zealand will hold a general election this year, most likely in September. The National Party is trailing the governing Labour Party by about 14% in the polls, but last year it polled better than the Labour Party following a speech on race relations by Don Brash at the same location a year earlier.
pair.h: The National Party is the leading party in New Zealand.

pair.t: New Zealand will hold a general election this year, most likely in September. The National Party is trailing the governing Labour Party by about 14% in the polls, but last year it polled better than the Labour Party following a speech on race relations by Don Brash at the same location a year earlier.
pair.h: The National Party won the general election in New Zealand.

pair.t: North American movie box offices were dominated by Universal pictures last weekend as two of its films, a comedy and a horror flick, together raked in a combined $52.6 million, more than half of the $98.3 all films made over the Jan. 7 weekend, according to film tracking firm Box Office Mojo.
pair.h: Universal pictures earned $52.6 million.

pair.t: Ex-British Culture Minister Chris Smith has lived with the HIV virus for 17 years, he has revealed to the Sunday Times. The former cabinet minister decided to go public after the former South African President Nelson Mandela announced his son Makgatho Mandela had died of AIDS.
pair.h: Ex-British Culture Minister suffers from AIDS.

pair.t: A new report by the International Federation of Journalists (IFJ) documents 129 cases where media workers have been killed because of their work during 2004. They expect the number to increase as more information reaches them. This could make 2004 the deadliest year ever. 49 casualties (close to 40%) occurred in Iraq, making it by far the deadliest country for journalists. At least 20 of those appeared to be cases where journalists were directly targeted because of their profession.
pair.h: 49 media workers were killed in Iraq in 2004.

pair.t: A new report by the International Federation of Journalists (IFJ) documents 129 cases where media workers have been killed because of their work during 2004. They expect the number to increase as more information reaches them. This could make 2004 the deadliest year ever. 49 casualties (close to 40%) occurred in Iraq, making it by far the deadliest country for journalists. At least 20 of those appeared to be cases where journalists were directly targeted because of their profession.
pair.h: IFJ is based in Iraq.

pair.t: A 38 year-old man has been arrested by the Customs and Excise Department of Hong Kong, for illegally distributing three copyrighted movies via BitTorrent file-sharing technology. However, the suspect was not immediately charged, and investigations are still underway, according to the Hong Kong Government. The law in Hong Kong allows for a sentence of up to four years in prison, and a US$6,400 fine per violation - defined as a single unauthorized copy of a protected work.
pair.h: A 38 year-old man from Hong Kong was sentenced to four years in prison for illegally distributing three copyrighted movies.

pair.t: Newly revealed documents from the UK government have revealed that Ugandan dictator Idi Amin offered his services as a mediator and peace broker during the 1970s in Northern Ireland. Amin was eventually toppled in 1979 by Ugandan dissidents and the Tanzanian army. He died in 2003 in Saudi Arabia.
pair.h: Idi Amin was a citizen of Northern Ireland.

pair.t: Newly revealed documents from the UK government have revealed that Ugandan dictator Idi Amin offered his services as a mediator and peace broker during the 1970s in Northern Ireland. Amin was eventually toppled in 1979 by Ugandan dissidents and the Tanzanian army. He died in 2003 in Saudi Arabia.
pair.h: The UK government supported Idi Amin.

pair.t: Despite Japan's claims of sovereignty over the islands, China has begun to claim some of the region's valuable oil and natural gas deposits to help alleviate the shortages for China's growing economy. China recently allowed leased oil drilling to commence within the area that Japan has declared as an "Economic Exclusion Zone". The name of the island chain is disputed. The Japanese refer to the islands as "Sento Shosho" or "Senkaku Retto," the People's Republic of China (PRC) and the Republic of China (Taiwan) call the island the same name. In PRC's pinyin system, the names spells "Diaoyu Dao" and in ROC's system "Tiao Yu Tai."
pair.h: Japan is in dispute with China over Sento Shosho.

pair.t: Romney was elected in 2003, replacing Jane Swift, and his term ends in January 2007. If he does decide to run for the presidency, he will have ample time when the term ends. So far, Romney has denied that he is running for President and may possibly change his mind and run for re-election. He also said that he would endorse his Lieutenant Governor, Kerry Healey if she decides to run for governor.
pair.h: Romney is a candidate to the presidency.

pair.t: Romney was also CEO of the Salt Lake Organizing Committee which was in charge of planning the 2002 Winter Olympics from 1999 to 2002. He took charge after the 2002 Winter Olympic bid scandal. He also sat on the board of Massachusetts-based office supply giant, Staples, Inc.
pair.h: Romney holds shares of Staples, Inc.

pair.t: The 15-year-old Australian boy, charged on Sunday night related to the alleged theft of a Tram, faces another nine charges over prior incidents, bringing the total to 18 charges. The new allegations relate to theft of a bus, attempted theft of a train, and another incident with a tram. On Monday he was also charged over an incident in which a tram was allegedly stolen from Southbank on Friday.
pair.h: An Australian boy is accused of stealing a bus.

pair.t: The University of California, Berkeley announced that one of its graduate students, Michael Park, rediscovered on May 24 the Mount Diablo buckwheat, a plant not sighted since 1936 and believed to have been extinct. Found nearly 30 miles east of San Francisco, Park [aged 35] identified the small pink flowering plant said to resemble baby's breath during a routine visit to the mountain. He is currently pursuing his doctorate in integrative biology.
pair.h: Michael Park is a biologist.

pair.t: Despite their relative size, Aromanians have very little, if no, minority rights. In Greece, for example, they are not recognised as a minority. In Romania, where there are an increasing number of Aromanians, many of them migrating from Greece, Macedonia and Albania, they are often considered as Romanians, because their language is partly mutually-intelligible with Romanian and their culture is relatively similar.
pair.h: Greece is the native country of Aromanians.

pair.t: Two new drugs used in the treatment of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder have been added to the Australian Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme (PBS), Health Minister Tony Abbott announced today. The new drugs are Risperdal Consta, for the treatment of schizophrenia, and Zyprexa, for the treatment of bipolar disorder.
pair.h: Tony Abbott suffers from bipolar disorder.

pair.t: Larry Robinson resigned as coach of the New Jersey Devils on Monday afternoon because of stress-related health issues. Devils president and general manager Lou Lamoriello will take over the coach position temporarily until the new coach would be brought "as soon as possible".
pair.h: Robinson suffers from stress-related health issues.

pair.t: The bill is in contrast to a different measure by Ted Kennedy (D-MA) and John McCain (R-AZ) submitted two months ago. The bill has republican co-sponsorship from Jim Kolbe and Jeff Flake, both from Arizona where the porous US-Mexican border is an issue.
pair.h: Jeff Flake was born in Arizona.

pair.t: The New York radio station HOT 97 has apologized after one of its DJs played a song making light of the recent tsunami catastrophe in Asia. The 'Tsunami Song' was played by 'Miss Jones' on the hip hop and R&B station's Morning show earlier this month. Miss Jones and station management later apologised on-air.
pair.h: Miss Jones works for HOT 97.

pair.t: Police reported to the Sandiganbayan, the anti-graft court investigating the former Philippine president, and leaked to the press, that Estrada had hosted members of his former cabinet for dinner and stayed overnight away from the hospital in which he is supposed to be confined. He is in hospital to undergo knee replacement surgery.
pair.h: Estrada was the president of the Philippines.

pair.t: According to Brazilian Sports website Gazeta Esportiva, the kidnapping occurred the night of Monday, March 21, in Campinas, 83,5 km (51.88 miles) of São Paulo. According to recent reports, three armed men kidnapped Inês Fidélis Régis, the mother of Rogério, who plays in Sporting Clube de Portugal.
pair.h: Inês Fidélis Régis was kidnapped on March 21.

pair.t: Swift has three main instruments. The BAT detects bursts and initiates the autonomous slewing to bring the XRT and the Ultraviolet/Optical Telescope (UVOT) within focus of the burst.
pair.h: UVOT is part of Swift.

pair.t: Mlambo-Ngcuka, a former school teacher, travelled to Geneva, Switzerland to work with the YWCA. She returned to South Africa in 1987 and assumed a leading role in the Ecumenical Action Group and other anti-apartheid groups. She was later elected to parliament and appointed deputy trade and industry minister.
pair.h: Mlambo-Ngcuka was a member of the South African parliament.

pair.t: In 2003 Mlambo-Ngcuka publicly accused Jacob Zuma of corruption, though the case was never formalized due to insufficient evidence. Her husband, former national director of Public Prosecutions Bulelani Ngcuka, investigated Zuma and concluded that prima facie evidence of corruption existed.
pair.h: Mlambo-Ngcuka is married to Bulelani Ngcuka.

pair.t: The UN in Congo have said that four people may have been killed in Kinshasa, but that is not yet confirmed. A journalist in the area saw bruised and bandaged protestors who said they had been beaten by police, and a local TV station broadcast images of a protester who they said had been shot dead. The station was raided shortly afterwards by police.
pair.h: Police killed a protester in Congo.

pair.t: Unrest has been growing among the 60 million residents in Congo - a former Belgian colony - over delays to the first democratic elections to be held for forty years. The elections - which should have been held before last Thursday - were agreed upon as part of a peace treaty that ended a five year civil war in 2003 - a war that had seen the deaths of four million people.
pair.h: Four million people died during the civil war in Congo.

pair.t: Mahameed purchased about 80 photographs from the more well-known museum at Yad Vashem in Jerusalem, site of Israel's national memorial to the holocaust, located on the Mount of Remembrance. The newly enlarged Israeli museum at Yad Vashem, opened March 15 with the attendance of President Moshe Katsav, replaced what was the world's first holocaust museum, established in 1972.
pair.h: Mahameed owns a museum in Jerusalem.

pair.t: Fazio has stepped down after an investigation into his role in a controversial bank takeover. Mario Draghi is to fill his shoes. Draghi's former job was managing director of the investment bank Goldman Sachs. Draghi will serve a six year term under a new law that set term limits for the Central bank's governor passed last week.
pair.h: Fazio worked for Goldman Sachs.

pair.t: Fazio has stepped down after an investigation into his role in a controversial bank takeover. Mario Draghi is to fill his shoes. Draghi's former job was managing director of the investment bank Goldman Sachs. Draghi will serve a six year term under a new law that set term limits for the Central bank's governor passed last week.
pair.h: Mario Draghi was appointed as governor of the Central bank.

pair.t: Maximum sustained winds are reported at 175 mph (78 m/s). Of great concern to New Orleans officials is the predicted coastal storm surge of 18 to 22 feet above normal tide levels. Destruction from flooding is expected since the city is situated below sea level.
pair.h: New Orleans is located below sea level.

pair.t: The response of Unionist politicians has been to accuse the police of brutal and heavy-handed tactics. Hugh Orde has praised the police for being "heroes", and suggested that no other police force in the UK, Europe, and perhaps even the US has had to deal with such ferocity in a public order situation. Unionists described the Chief Constable's comments as "inflammatory".
pair.h: Hugh Orde belongs to the Unionists.

pair.t: A power outage in a large portion of Los Angeles, California occurred at approximately 13:00 PST (20:00 UTC) on Monday. Reports from the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power indicate that the incident was caused by a worker who accidentally cut a line. The outage caused a chain reaction that took out power to a large part of the city.
pair.h: A worker caused a power outage in Los Angeles.

pair.t: Lithuania joined the European Union in 2004, and like the other new member states, it is obliged to adopt the euro when it is ready.
pair.h: Lithuania is a member of the European Union.

pair.t: Prime Minister of Lebanon, Omar Karami, stepped down yet again Thursday, April 14 after failing to reach a consensus in negotiations on candidates to fill key cabinet positions necessary for scheduled elections to take place in May. Karami said he could no longer work with President Emile Lahoud.
pair.h: Emile Lahoud is the president of Lebanon.

pair.t: During her visit, she participated in recording an episode of the Egyptian Arabic version of the Sesame Street television program. The Muppet characters are similar to the U.S. version, but have Arabic names, such as Khokhah, a peach-colored little Muppet girl. Mrs. Bush emphasized the importance of learning to read in her appearance, which is probably to be broadcast on the show's next season.
pair.h: Mrs. Bush speaks Arabic.

pair.t: The Inuit will become owners of 15,800 square kilometers of the land, and will co-manage the balance. Under the agreement the Government of Canada will transfer $140 million to the Labrador Inuit, as well as $156 million for implementation.
pair.h: The Government of Canada supports the Labrador Inuit.

pair.t: Kuwait becomes the fourth Gulf country where women as well as men can vote in elections after Bahrain, Oman and Qatar. Saudi Arabia holds strictly limited, male-only elections.
pair.h: Qatar women participate in elections.

pair.t: Kuwait's donation was followed by a $100 million donation from Qatar, a small, U.S. friendly peninsula jutting out into the Red Sea.
pair.h: Kuwait has friendly relations with Qatar.

pair.t: The House of Councilors, the upper house of the Diet of Japan, voted on the controversial bill that would have privatized the Japanese Postal Service at around 1 p.m. (JST, UTC +8) on Monday, August 8. The bill was rejected by a slim margin - 108 for, 125 against, one abstention and two intentional absences - after a rebellion within the ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP).
pair.h: The House of Councilors voted against a controversial bill.

pair.t: Annan praised the courage of the people and congratulated the Independent Election Commission of Iraq (IECI) and UN officials for successfully running the poll.
pair.h: Annan is a member of the IECI.

pair.t: Pre-election polls had predicted that pro-business Donald Tusk, the leader of conservative-liberal party Citizens' Platform, would win the election.
pair.h: Donald Tusk won the election.

pair.t: Kaczynski, nicknamed "the duck", will replace Aleksander Kwasniewski, who was ineligible to be elected again, as he was the president of Poland for ten years.
pair.h: Kaczynski works for Kwasniewski.

pair.t: In the first turn Kaczynski from Law and Justice Party gained about 34% of votes, while his main rival attracted about 37% of Polish society.
pair.h: Kaczynski is the leader of Law and Justice Party.

pair.t: In the first turn Kaczynski from Law and Justice Party gained about 34% of votes, while his main rival attracted about 37% of Polish society.
pair.h: 37% of the Polish society voted for Kaczynski.

pair.t: JP Morgan was involved in a class action suit in 2002 which sought reparations for slavery from it and 17 other companies. The case was dismissed last year. The bank will establish a $5 million, need-based scholarship for African-American students in Louisiana.
pair.h: JP Morgan is based in Louisiana.

pair.t: Citizens Bank and Canal Bank in Louisiana, which were ultimately acquired by JP Morgan, accepted approximately 13,000 slaves as collateral and took ownership of approximately 1250 between 1831 and 1865, according to a memo to employees from CEO and Chairman William Harrison and President James Dimon.
pair.h: JP Morgan owns Citizens Bank.

pair.t: Citizens Bank and Canal Bank in Louisiana, which were ultimately acquired by JP Morgan, accepted approximately 13,000 slaves as collateral and took ownership of approximately 1250 between 1831 and 1865, according to a memo to employees from CEO and Chairman William Harrison and President James Dimon.
pair.h: William Harrison worked for Citizens Bank and Canal Bank.

pair.t: He said that in order to fight the "dark forces" of Islamic terrorism NATO needs to take in like-minded nations such as Australia, Israel and Japan and create a strategic association with regional powers such as India and Colombia.
pair.h: Australia intends to join NATO.

pair.t: He said that in order to fight the "dark forces" of Islamic terrorism NATO needs to take in like-minded nations such as Australia, Israel and Japan and create a strategic association with regional powers such as India and Colombia.
pair.h: Islamic terrorists attacked Australia, Israel and Japan.

pair.t: Allied Command Operations (ACO) is in Belgium and is headed by the Supreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR) who is always an American four star general with the dual role of heading U.S. European Command as well.
pair.h: An American four star general is the head of ACO.

pair.t: On 18 October 2005 at 11 am, multi-Guinness World Record holder Suresh Joachim will attempt to break the world record for the longest time in a static cycling marathon. The current record is held jointly by Niels Rietveld and Edwin Snijders, both of the Netherlands, who set the record at Sports Studio Buiten in Almere, Netherlands.
pair.h: Suresh Joachim comes from the Netherlands.

pair.t: Joachim's record attempts are used as fundraisers for the Universal Fund For Suffering Children.
pair.h: Joachim supports Universal Fund for Suffering Children.

pair.t: Spencer Dryden was a member of Jefferson Airplane during the band's heyday. He replaced original drummer Skip Spence and played with Jefferson Airplane at the legendary Woodstock and Altamont rock festivals.
pair.h: Skip Spence was a member of Jefferson Airplane.

pair.t: Spencer Dryden was a member of Jefferson Airplane during the band's heyday. He replaced original drummer Skip Spence and played with Jefferson Airplane at the legendary Woodstock and Altamont rock festivals.
pair.h: Skip Spence participated in the Woodstock and Altamont rock festivals.

pair.t: Spencer Dryden, the drummer of the legendary American rock band Jefferson Airplane, passed away on Tuesday, Jan. 11. He was 66. Dryden suffered from stomach cancer and heart disease.
pair.h: Spencer Dryden died at 66.

pair.t: Flood warnings were issued from north Okinawa to Tokyo. Rain amounts were predicted to be greater than 19 inches (483 millimeters) for Kyushu, Japan's third largest island, and some areas may receive as much as 1 to 2 inches of rain per hour.
pair.h: Kyushu is located north of Okinawa.

pair.t: The typhoon knocked power and water out for thousands of homes and has so far claimed two lives, including one man struck by lightning.
pair.h: Two people were killed by the typhoon.

pair.t: At the present time, the Japanese imperial household has no male member under the age of 20; present law only allows male descendants to ascend to the Chrysanthemum Throne. The proposed solution would put Princess Aiko, the sole child of Crown Prince Naruhito and Crown Princess Masako in place as the most likely to inherit the position of monarch.
pair.h: Princess Aiko is a member of the Japanese imperial household.

pair.t: Janez Janša, the Prime Minister of Slovenia, will again serve as the President of the Slovenian Democratic Party (SDS) after he was reelected in a party congress held in Portorož Saturday. Janša has been the leader of SDS since 1993.
pair.h: The Prime Minister of Slovenia belongs to the Slovenian Democratic Party.

pair.t: On Thursday, the Ivorian rebel group Forces Nouvelles, responded to the South African mediator's Wednesday testimony to the UN Security Council by saying that South Africa had become "discredited" by taking the side of Ivorian president Laurent Gbagbo's government in Abidjan.
pair.h: Forces Nouvelles is based in Abidjan.

pair.t: Special Representative of the Secretary-General to Cote d'Ivoire, Pierre Schori, expressed his support for the continued South African mediation and stated that conducting free and fair elections in Cote d'Ivoire was more important than sticking with the set dates.
pair.h: Pierre Schori is a citizen of Cote d'Ivoire.

pair.t: The wreck of the plane ATR72 that fell into the sea near Sicily, Italy on August 6 has been recovered. One of the three people who were still missing from the accident was found, while there is yet no sign of the other two persons.
pair.h: Three people died in a plane accident in Italy.

pair.t: The World Summit on the Information Society, organized by the International Telecommunication Union, concluded on Friday evening, November 18th, in Tunis, the capital of the north African nation of Tunisia.
pair.h: The International Telecommunication Union is based in Tunisia.

pair.t: During the event, representatives from the Global Voices project were menaced by the Tunisian police as they held their session on "Expression Under Repression." Speaking at the session were Rebecca MacKinnon, Ethan Zuckerman, Nart Villeneuve, Taurai Maduna, Isaac Mao, and Hossein Derakshan, among others.
pair.h: Rebecca MacKinnon participates in the Global Voices project.

pair.t: In Spain, which saw attacks on Madrid last year, the Spanish Government said it would help the UK "pursue the criminals who have carried out such a repugnant attack against a city that was celebrating its election as the host of the Games of the XXX Olympiad".
pair.h: Spain is in friendly relations with the UK.

pair.t: Mioara Mantale was appointed yesterday as the new prefect of Romania's capital Bucharest. She is the first female prefect in the history of the city.
pair.h: Mantale is the first female prefect of Bucharest.

pair.t: The choice of Wolfowitz is raising controversy in Europe and developing nations. Known as hawkish and outspoken, Wolfowitz was a pro-Iraqi war neo-conservative in his role as deputy Secretary of Defense, and a chief architect in the build up to war with Iraq.
pair.h: Wolfowitz approved of the Iraqi war.

pair.t: Microsoft has made a name for itself in legal circles as a company that fiercely defends its trademarks and other intellectual property. With the choice of "Vista," the tables may turn as it may face allegations of swiping another company's trademark.
pair.h: Vista is a Microsoft trademark.

pair.t: It appears the Vista name has already been taken by another high-tech company, coincidentally also based in Redmond. A few miles from the sprawling Microsoft campus is Vista Incorporated, which has operated a small business internet interchange since it was founded by Wall Data founder, John Wall in 2000. He was surprised by his larger neighbor's move.
pair.h: Vista Incorporated is owned by Microsoft.

pair.t: Bob Rosenschein, Answers.com's founder and CEO, told the media that Wikipedia is "the most dynamic of over 120 content sources found in Answers.com".
pair.h: Rosenschein is the owner of Wikipedia.

pair.t: Bob Rosenschein, Answers.com's founder and CEO, told the media that Wikipedia is "the most dynamic of over 120 content sources found in Answers.com".
pair.h: Wikipedia is affiliated with Answers.com.

pair.t: The Wikimedia Foundation, the mother organization of the popular Wikipedia encyclopedia, and Answers.com, a search engine company, announced a new partnership.
pair.h: The Wikimedia Foundation is a partner of Answers.com.

pair.t: "Hubble is in year 14 of a planned 15-year mission," the official said. "Trying to send a robotic mission to extend that time period would be a $2 billion gamble with taxpayer dollars where the odds are 80-20 that it would fail."
pair.h: Hubble mission was planned to take 15 years.

pair.t: "Hubble is in year 14 of a planned 15-year mission," the official said. "Trying to send a robotic mission to extend that time period would be a $2 billion gamble with taxpayer dollars where the odds are 80-20 that it would fail."
pair.h: To extend the Hubble mission would cost $2 billion.

pair.t: The White House eliminated funding for a service mission to the Hubble Space Telescope from its 2006 budget request and directed NASA to focus on deorbiting the spacecraft at the end of its life, according to government and industry sources.
pair.h: The White House will finance a service mission to the Hubble Space Telescope.

pair.t: The White House eliminated funding for a service mission the Hubble Space Telescope from its 2006 budget request and directed NASA to focus on deorbiting the spacecraft at the end of its life, according to government and industry sources.
pair.h: NASA destroyed the Hubble Space Telescope.

pair.t: Wells Fargo has a long term goal of deriving around 25% of its revenue from investments and insurance; currently it derives around 15 percent of its revenue from this. The purchase of Barclays Global Investor would significantly move Wells Fargo toward achieving this goal.
pair.h: Wells Fargo trades in investments and insurance.

pair.t: James Gilchrist, a former Marine and a retired accountant from Aliso Viejo, Arizona, who ran the sign-up effort, said he expected more than 1,000 volunteers to help highlight the 30-day effort.
pair.h: James Gilchrist worked as an accountant.

pair.t: The abuse of children aged between six months and 12 years took place in a poor and deprived area of the western French town of Angers.

pair.t: By analysing the code of the Zotob worm, as well as its derivative works, law enforcement officials have found that three internet gangs were involved in the creation of the worm. Farid Essebar, aka 'Diab10', the 18 year old who wrote the worm, as well as others, like Mytob, was a member of the gang '0x90-Team'. The other gangs, 'BlackCarder' and 'MetalHit', wrote some of the variants of Zotob and Mytob.
pair.h: Farid Essebar created the Zotob worm.

pair.t: By analysing the code of the Zotob worm, as well as its derivative works, law enforcement officials have found that three internet gangs were involved in the creation of the worm.
